I tried Copper Star, Fair Trade, LUX, Lola, and Conspire during the year and a half we lived there and none provided the atmosphere of a true coffeehouse where you can relax, listen to music, converse with friends, and maybe view some local art while chowing on a healthy snack...except Urban Beans.  The owner works the counter, is conversational and friendly, and really enjoys what she does.  The coffee shops in Phoenix tend to be so small that the enjoyment of the patrons really seems like an afterthought.  Every coffee shop we visited (except Urban Beans) had no seating room.  Kids (I use that term loosely...think 23 and under) bring in their laptops, order a drip coffee, and sit all day long taking up space that others could be using while enjoying a coffee. The kids who work at the coffeehouses don't seem to care because it's their FRIENDS who are hanging out on the couches the entire day.  Urban Beans is for grown-ups and for people who want to experience good coffee in a friendly atmosphere, while nibbling on a salad, then continuing with life elsewhere after an hour or so of kabitzing.    Gawd, I sound old! :)

How can you not love a local coffee joint that hits you with a deadly combination of premium beans, 24/7/365 hours, scrumptious food, and wine? You haven't lived until you have visited Urban Beans - that's the bottom line. I regularly come here for an unusually large iced coffee and amazing breakfasts. I love how patient and friendly the staff is to customers and I particularly enjoy the rotating local artists' work they display on their walls. This local hotspot is truly a gem of our community - I can't even imagine the neighborhood without it!

I am a frequent at Urban Beans for good reason.   One reason I continually come back to Urban Beans is because of their delicious drinks and pastries that are dairy and gluten-free. UB makes the best almond milk London Fogs in town. They are rich, and composed of quality ingredients.   Another reason I love UB, is because of the quality of their pastries. UB continually introduces new eccentric items to their menu are always delectable. They offer an array of gluten-free and vegan options.   Finally, the employees at UB are polite, and experienced. Simply put, they know what they are doing.   Lastly, my only critique of UB is that they revisit their WIFI set and seating arrangements. Trying to access their WIFI is the equivalent of breaking into Fort Knox, that is, not easy. Moreover, they just need more seats with a table. There are too many here for everyone to sit comfortably at a table, especially if you're with a group larger than 5.   Nonetheless, please come to UB, I promise you will not be disappointed and they will come through on all of your gluttonous desires.

Just checked this place out since I recently moved right down the street. They must have heard that people were having a poor experience with regard to service because the guy helping me out was really friendly and talked with me for a bit about the different teas they offer.   I saw that they also offer food/wine tastings on certain nights. The chef who coordinates this was also the barista who took my drink order.   I agree with everyone that says the interior needs some renovation. I like the bright open space but some reading chairs and more wall decoration would certainly spruce the place up! All in all, it's a close, locally owned place that I'll be sure to stop by again when I need to.

I so want to love and support local coffee bars. With a Starbucks on the same block, I wish I could say I'll be choosing Urban Beans in the future. Unfortunately, I won't be frequenting this place.   The atmosphere is adorable, and the location is very convenient. The sweet female barista made me a "surprise" latte when I couldn't decide, and it was delicious! However, after waiting over ten minutes for my quiche to warm up, I approached the gentleman behind the counter. With a massive attitude, he told me it's "not coming up because I don't see any tickets behind here a quiche on it. Go talk to her."  Oh, I'm sorry. Did my being a customer interfere with your ability to do your job?  I'm just sorry I left a 15% tip before all this happened.   Want a decent latte? Feel free to go to Urban Beans. Prefer good customer service? Head to Starbucks.
The food is pretty good. We had the cauliflower bisque (it was okay), a caprese sandwich (very good) and black current tea. The atmosphere was a bit Dobie Gillis, which was part of the charm.

I love the variety of food and drinks they have here. Nice and cozy environment, very friendly. Also love the artwork on the wall. This is the kind of place I would like to hang out with a nice drink and a book or a sketchbook. I am also very thrilled to learn that dogs are allowed on the patio! I'm definitely coming back with my dog (and the rest of my family too!)

Very poor staff, simply just unprofessional. Not acknowledging customers, having loud obnoxious conversations behind the counter, drinking a beer on the job, really?! Only been here a few times and had the same experience each time.

I go to Urban Bean a LOT for coffee.  My husband and I have hit lunch there a couple times.  Just invited two friends for happy hour after being told by a worker that wine is $5.00 a glass, draft beer $3.00.  Our bill came  -  YIKES!!!   First our waitress didn't give us any happy hour price on our wine and then we find out that it's $5.00 on 'certain' glass' and $1.00 off the others.  I tried to use my Belly points, but they amounted to a big FAT ZERO.   No one even thought of giving us what we were told, so I guess with all the fantastic happy hours out there, I won't be back.  Sad that business' don't care enough to keep a happy customer insert a sad face here.

My favorite cafe in the Phoenix valley! It's just the right amount of cool vibes but still relaxed and not pretentious. Great selection of different kind of drinks and food too. Perfect for studying or just hanging out.
Nice place, like the coffee.  Lots of snacks and baked goods too.  Could double their business by getting comfortable chairs.

Overall, love Urban Beans, especially that it's open 24 hours.   5/5 for the community friendliness, environment, cafe design, and atmosphere.   3/5 for the inconsistent quality of coffee and food (and sometimes service). I live in the neighborhood and visit UB at least one a week. Based on the taste alone, I would never know if I was at the same coffee shop. One example is the hot Mocha. At best, it doesn't taste like chocolate at all; at worst it's like drinking cardboard dissolved in water. Please UB management, test out a new mocha espresso recipe.

Update:   As I continue to frequent this place, the customer service is increasingly erratic and the food less fresh. I can't even describe how one of the women tried to get the bottom of the brew into my cup and then when not full, starting taking drips from a fresh pot being brewed and adding it to my cup. By the time she finished, I had lost my appetite for the cup she prepared. Ew! I have to downgrade my original rating because of too many disappointing visits. It's a shame as it is not well managed and customer service training clearly lacking.  Earlier review: Adorable local coffee shop with an interesting array of local art on the wall. You'll know you've arrived when you spot the Ducati bike outside. I usually just get their coffee, which is always great, but they do serve lunch and breakfast, especially muffins and pastries. The only downside is that sometimes service is a tad slower than you'd like.

First visit here and I'm pleasantly surprised!  Great breve cappuccino and I just love when they decorate the froth!  I can't give it 5 stars because it just wasn't THAT impressive but I'll certainly return.

Great Local business. Casual, cool, calm atmosphere. Great chill vibes and great service. From there iced teas to there blended beverages, service was A+! Another positive highlight is they are open 24hrs! Support your local businesses and come take a gander.

I love this place. I've been here a handful of times and keep coming back because of the atmosphere.   Coffee is pretty much coffee everywhere. I've been to several and they're all pretty much the same. That's the case here too.   But the reason this place is great is because of the vibe. It's a spacious room with white walls, mismatched chairs and tables.   It's a good place to come and chill out. It's very quiet and laid back.   I did have the red velvet cupcake they had once before and I wasn't a fan. But it wasn't terrible.   I like to meet up with one of my friends here from time to time. The patio is nice, but it's alongside a busy street so it's a little noisy.   Service depends on who is there. I've gotten some people who are very friendly and nice, and some who just ask you what your order is and hand it out.

I have been to UB off and on for over 5 years. I love the eclectic feel, the homemade pastries, and the sense of comfort. As a consultant without an office, I love when I can find a place with free WiFi where I work for several hours. Although my experience is that the baristas/servers change often, they are most often kind and helpful. My greatest complaint is that in all the years I've been to UB their restrooms are DIRTY. Bathrooms are unisex...which is fine. But when I walk in with the toilet seat up and it's covered in urine drops...it's gross. I've literally walked in to one of the restrooms and there was who knows what all over the seat. I walked out. This bothers me not only when I need to use the restroom but also because Dept of health folks always say that if the bathroom is not well kept,  question the kitchens cleanliness. I looked for their letter rating...maybe I missed it somewhere.

One star is over rating.  It is no longer the coffee shop I once knew and loved. Everything there is now vegan which I noticed deters some of the customers, and the old menu has gone through a few changes none of which were very great.  Food is inconsistent and overpriced.
The women who work the counter are the rudest people I've ever encountered in a small establishment. I guess they have so much business they don't care to lose customers.
Very good food great atmosphere.  If you want a taco but something different.  Try the Peking duck taco.

I ordered Mediterranean salad and it was spicy with organic greens and hint of raspberry. So yummy!  The loose leaf tea was great and comes in a little glass pot, very nice. The price is right, no doubt. Service was quick and efficient, even though the place looked busy. There some comfy chairs around if you stay for a while and Buffalo exchange near by. Overall awesome place and it exceeded my expectations :). Thanks guys!

I absolutely love this place!!! I have been coming here for over a year. I have called this my personal office since I was in school! The internet is free, the tea is wonderful, and the food is second to none! The staff always goes the extra mile, and I have never had a bad experience there. A+ in my book!
I have eaten here twice.  The food is good, however the poor customer service and general incompetence by the staff does not make-up for it.  I'll never go back.
Great late night place for coffee and relax. Late night spot for students.  Friendly place

Love the coffee, espresso, and the establishment.  They also have awesome scones.  The owners try to remember all names and faces and are always super friendly.  This place is real close to my office, so I try to stop in at least once a day for a coffee or espresso.

I'm sitting here as I write this.I'm thoroughly unimpressed.   With its bare white walls and sparse attempts at decor, this place is overly and unreasonably obnoxious. Despite not being crowded, and there never being more than one person in front of me each time, I had to wait on line.  With two people working behind the counter there's no reason to forget my order or make me wait 5+ minutes each time I needed something (to get my coffee, to ask for the Internet password, and then to remind them that I ordered coffee). Unfortunately the coffee supplied was  mediocre as best. Disruptive music selection that was too damn loud. Annoying..thank God for pandora.com, a good set of ear-bud, and reasonable wi-fi or I never would have gotten any work done.  The only reason I'd come back here is if my son had another concert to attend nearby. Needless to say, I do not recommend.

Cute little coffee shop/wine bar in Central Phoenix!  Friendly staff and tasty treats.  I enjoyed my raspberry Italian soda yesterday...perfectly mixed with just the right amount of syrup, soda and cream.

I am surprised how good their vegan pastries are! They are available in many different flavors and varieties. I ordered a plum scone and a gingerbread latte. Both are beyond excellent! The contemporary hip atmosphere is perfect for meetups, or to spend a couple hours chilling with your laptop. I went there at dinner time and they are full. Glad there is a full vegan diner that opens 24 hours!

Urban Beans is a cool spot ya'll.  The interior is simple and pleasant.  The windows allow a lot of light to come in to make a nice bright atmosphere.  The walls have cool art and chalk drawings.   The drinks are good and reasonably priced.  Try the scones and biscotti.  They are excellent.  Urban Beans has WiFi and an outside patio area.  The baristas are friendly and hip.  I have been there on an open musician night and it was a nice surprise.  Urban Beans seems to be doing everything right.  What a great addition to Central Phoenix.

Finally stopped in for coffee.  Been driving past it for ages. Atmosphere is not fancy but clean bought a regular cup of coffee. Best way to test a brand is regular coffee nothing exotic. Coffee was great. I like coffee strong but not so strong it is bitter. Coffee was strong but not so strong it drove itself home. A hidden gem. Worth the trip into town.
Good coffee, nice patio and friendly service. What more can you ask for. Nice to find local flavor. Thanks for reading. The Bike Chaplain

Sadly this place is not good. It used to be. It was my go to coffee shop in Phoenix. But the coffee was bitter and bad. My fault that I did not know the menu changed to all vegan but the once delicious scones changed. The one I had was inedible and 1 bite was more than enough. So I paid $7 for wifi, which was good and fast. So that's the one star. Too bad as I always recommended this place to everyone.
What a find! Good coffee and wine selection. Decent desserts, nice ambience and great outdoor patio...AND open 24 hours! Finally, Phoenix needed one of these!

Great little place!  Took my daughter their after an appointment and used a coupon.  They took they coupon right away.  They food was great loved the little salad that came with our Veggie sandwich.  Really like that they have a dog friendly patio.  Will definitely be back.

Wanted to get a vegan meal for my girlfriend drove 20 min out, called in ordered, when I got their they did not have issues with the system. Sat at the store for another 35 min to get my food to go. Understaffed and don't seem to know what they are doing. Sad since we are new to Phx area, also once I got the food to go it was not all that and I paid almost 30 dollars for 2 meals. Sad since we need some good vegan places in AZ! But 1 hour to prepare the food then when I also let them know what is going on and that this is taking too long. No sorry, or say something to make the situation better just it's gonna be ready soon lol! Can't believe this place has 4 stars!

I've been going here for years, and it is my go to cafe. I love the decor, the art, and the ambiance of the place. The staff is always super friendly, place is very clean, and it's a cafe that's different. they have super comfortable chairs and a full bar andddd.... I probably should have kept this place a secret. Def one of my hideouts/ places I go to get stuff done. Highly recommended :)
The best coffee I have ever had. I ordered a latte with almond milk. i think much better than Starbucks and the customer service is outstanding.

I hope this was an off day but I would be super embarrassed as the owner of this place. The customer service was atrocious. They all seemed out of it. Super slow. Coffee took 30 minutes because he didn't see the cups sitting right next to him. He continued to help others coming in, although it was not busy by any means. The drinks were not good. We left them after we got our 45 minute burritos. Communication is all it takes. Train your employees.   Also, menu online does not match what they're selling. Update. Change. Do something. Have some common sense and courtesy.

Even though we live within walking distance of several great coffee houses we have been consistently thrilled with the service and coffee at Urban Bean.  I have been ordering from the menu and the made fresh egg dishes have all come out fluffy and done to perfection. An extensive list of "add in" vegetables means never really ordering the same thing twice! They have yet to decline my request for sliced tomatoes instead of the potatoes that  normally come with this selection.  The cold brew, which I always order, is always smooth and clean. Never over boiled or burnt, never bitter.  There are receptacles and power strips available for charging computers etc. A nice atmosphere with different seating options and music that charms without being intrusive.  Service is always solicitous and at the same time friendly, genuine and warm.

My parents and I went to Urban Beans tonight because I had a restaurant.com coupon.  There is plenty of parking, the cafe is large and there was plenty of room to sit.    We did not stay and eat due to a person playing very loudly on his keyboard so we couldn't converse with the person at the counter without shouting.  This is the kind of place for non-amplified music, but luckily the person took a break about two minutes after we had ordered our food to go.    When we arrived home we found that they had forgotten two of our salads, but everything we had ordered had been prepared well.  Not sure if Ill go back, but it was worth the discounted price.

The basic house coffee was warm (not hot) and it wasn't fresh on my first visit there several months ago. But I'll give them another shot at some point. If you can't get your basic coffee right, there's a big problem.

Sunday omelette :)  A "MUST VISIT" if you're in Phoenix.  Food here is great and very healthy (then again, I eat a 3.99 bag of chips by myself every other day so my definition of 'healthy' may not be yours).  Portions here are very reasonable and it is enough to get you to that "good" feeling of satisfaction.    Atmosphere has a mix of college students and older crowd.

We were heading home after the Mercury's game and I wanted coffee unfortunately you were unable to make a white mocha but you had a wonderful lemon cupcake available for me and a vegan chocolate cupcake for my sister so it was worth the trip.
I can say this is one of the best vegetarian/vegan places I have been. Great flavor. Great environment. Loved it!!

I usually like to support independent coffee stands, but this place needs to step up its game.  Friday I ordered my usual nonfat latte. The barista told me they didn't have nonfat milk, but had rice milk, soy milk, and almond milk. Thinking I misunderstood her, I asked "You don't have any milk?" to which she said they had whole milk. How does a coffee house not have a few types of cow's milk? Do that many patrons get rice milk in their coffee drinks? Ick. I guess I'm just not hip enough. Urban Beans usually makes a pretty good coffee and their bakery items are good. But it is starting to look a little dingy and dirty and seriously, a coffee house shouldn't run out of milk.  Update:  I visited again in March of 2018 to give Urban Beans another try.  This visit the barista informed me they were "plant based" and do not serve cow's milk.  (They didn't used to be.)  So, unless you are vegan, lactose intolerant or for some other reason don't drink cow's milk, you might want to visit Starbucks across the street.

We spent the day here doing work on our laptops, eating some food and drinking various offerings of the cafe. They graciously allowed us to keep our dog inside despite the open patio, and let us camp out at the bar for ~5 hours.   The chai latte is probably the best I have had anywhere, but their smashes are lacking in flavor, though the combinations are imaginitive. I was happy to discover their gluten free scone, but found it somewhat bland as well, though the fruit baked in was very good. The java chip scone was pretty good, as well, and neither were dry like scones usually are. We also got the kale beet salad, which bordered on scrumptious: the beets were cooked perfectly, and the rest mixed well. I think it was worth the twn dollars. No doubt, this place is quite expensive. The regular brew was ok - tasted a little burned, but tolerable.   The music selection was great (wish I had asked what pandora station it was...), and wasn't too loud. It's a comfortable little place and the service is very good. We enjoyed our afternoon here!
Love the New Yorker bfast sandwich !  Amazing! Open 24/7.. thirst quencher ? Green mint iced tea! I survived off this iced tea

I love this place! What a great experience! My boyfriend and I stopped in for the first time randomly and was met with cordial baristas, a pleasant atmosphere and a wonderful menu. Nice beer and wine selections- I had the Pinot Noir and he had the Camelback IPA. We were starving and even though we barely missed the cut off for food they still made us a delectable caprese sandwich! Best yet, they have a chess board and we were elated to see they host tournaments! We will definitely be back- be sure to tip well because these guys deserve it ;)

This has become my go-to place to meet people for coffee meetings. I also had a pretty regular Sunday date with my pal to get work done for the last few months. The staff is friendly, and there is solid food available.   It is clear that the people who work here are invested in its success, which is a nice thing to feel when you're spending a few hours in a place. They have mac and cheese and other real delicious bites so I don't have to eat a scone (my issue with most coffee shops).
Strong cold brew and really good vegan scones!! I go here all the time! The internet is kind of slow so maybe not the best for work though.
Why did I wait so long to review this place! Best coffee and vegetarian sandwiches! So tasty!  I play chess there all the time! My go to coffee shop for chill vibes

They just rolled out a new menu that I am not a big fan of. All breakfast sandwiches, burritos, and wraps were removed from the menu. With the exception of the pastries, everything is now build-your-own.  In addition to a complete overhaul of their menu, they were completely out of a handful of ingredients they had listed on their new menu. I was so overwhelmed with their extensive list of ingredients and options, I ended up just getting coffee (which is always a winning decision here).  I most likely won't be eating here again. If I wanted to build my own breakfast, I would have just stayed at home. Restaurants and cafes are supposed to share and suggest what THEY'RE good at making, not what ingredients they have for me to choose from.  Sorry Urban Beans, as a coffee shop, you get 5/5, but as a cafe, I'm now giving you 1/5.

Cute place, interesting and fairly priced menu. Unique clientele (e.g. Tattooed Lady, Old Muscle Guy). Coffee, purportedly medium roast, was way too weak to enjoy, as I am a "stron coffee aficionado."  Blueberry Bran muffin was to die for.   Lady on counter was lost at using the available technology, must have been new. Not necessarily a "do over" because of the not very good coffee and proximity to Starbucks and Lux.  Two Stars because of the VERY GOOD Muffin!

Three stars only because it's a 24 hour shop in a great neighboorhood .... however this new menu sucks with a capital S ! I usually sit on the patio and it would super super super nice if there was some music playing outside to distract from the street noise that would be perfect  .... it's super awkward in there and outside sometimes so I would hope they would add some music to add to the ambiance of this place . Also the food takes forever ! It's great but if I'm paying 15 dollars for a two small sandwiches give me a break and get it to me in less then half an hour ... I mean come on .

Consistently delicious iced mochas & incredibly friendly staff. Check this spot out if you're in the mood for an iced mocha, and soon enough we all will be ready for sinfully delicious iced coffee drinks once things heat up.  They're baked good and bagels are supplied through Simply Bread, so they're solidly yummy as well.   I feel like they could improve the place with respect to making it cozier, it has sort of an awkwardness to the space planning (some Persian rugs maybe?), but it's still a sweet little biz that we all should try and support.  Wi-Fi, sunshine, and quietness also make it a great spot to work or meet a client for a casual meeting.

I love this spot. Great coffee, decent selection of tea as well. And their food, wow. The #3 burrito is excellent, but you really can't go wrong with any of their options. Nice chessboard. Free wifi.  And to top it all off, they have a 24 hour bar! My only critique is the seating can be kind of tight when they are busy, but I don't feel like it's worth docking them a star. I'm an Urban Bean boy, through and through. You should be too. Or a girl, they are also cool. Am I rhyming, wow I sound like a fool.

The location and atmosphere are fun. However, the product left a lot to be desired.  We ordered two iced drinks. The employee was shaky -- at best -- as to how to make an iced Americano. Ultimately, the drinks were watered down and barely drinkable.  Some training could easily correct this and then we'd return.

Updating my review and lowering the stars. If you go here get the lasagna and the lasagna ONLY. The drinks and deserts are usually pretty terrible. As a vegan I want to love this place but it's been consistently bad. Urban Beans, PLEASE reach out to Green and The Coronado for some advice. I want your place to be just as good.

So I heard about this place thru an acquaintance. She said she knew the owner, so I thought I'd give it a whirl. I just switched jobs, so it conveniently put me across the street from this place on 7th St just north of Osborn. At first I wasn't sure where it was, but the sign that you'll probably see best,  is their Urban Beans sidewalk sign and the other one is hidden behind trees for the most part (its actually their quaint patio with trees in the front that blocks the building. Anyway, I was eager to enter, so off I went. I found parking in the medium-sized parking lot, walked up to find the patio (as mentioned above) and entered the coffee house. It had the same feel as those you might find on Roosevelt. Really artsy and laid back. It has artwork that changes out once a month I believe and...FREE WIFI... yay! And please note, this place offers gluten-free products. I know that is important to a lot of people. So that's a bonus! Also the staff is very friendly and warm. Its so rare to get good customer service nowadays so I really boast about it when cust. service is good. They were eager to help me figure out what I'd like to drink and eat. The guy behind the counter went over the specials and everything. I ordered the turkey with brie. DELISH!  The turkey and brie (good sized portion by the way) had a very nice soft bread and cranberry aioli, brie cheese, with arugula. It also came with a side arugula salad. Very yummy. And I'm pretty sure those were homemade croutons in there too, but not sure though. Now about the coffee. I got one of the many monthly specials decaf / non-fat 'Gingerbread latte'.  Even though I love coffee, I rarely drink it b/c I don't drink caffeinated beverages any longer, but a decaf cup carries little caffeine so I indulge a few times a year. So this drink is way better than the gingerbread latte at Starbucks. (Dare I utter the words Starbucks in this place, they would prob. kick me out..lol) It was bold, creamy and very flavorful. I really enjoyed it. In fact, a few days later, I got another one!!   Go ahead and try this place, I have already recommended it to a fellow co-worker, and he too, loved this place and is going to go back again.
great place that is locally owned. food and drinks and prices are all good!

Ok first time here. Girl with a smile behind counter so starting out well. Hands me the plastic menu. Dirty!  Very Dirty. Ordering went well and she got all that right. You order at counter and get your own water. Do you still tip 20%? Not sure but computer came up automatically 18 or 20 or other on screen. That was dirty also.   Went to bathroom to wash hands. The door has dirty blue tape on it but overall bathroom good. No print out of receipt. Waiting on food now.... Tofu scramble and jackfruit to come...  Ok scramble here and jackfruit came 4 min after. Not that big of a deal as this is not a 100% full service restaurant. Potatoes seem to be frozen ones - however, not bad as the price is right. Not for sure if they are frozen or not. The gal made adjustments with a smile and the cook got all correct. The scramble was a little salty. Overall good. Now the jackfruit tacos - I adjusted to corn tortilla instead of a torta. WOW. Outstanding!  Maybe best I've had. Let me say it again - Outstanding!  A little cleaning and lighten up on salt and this place is a 5 star. I will return. Wait....  I went to get the scone. The gal was very helpful on what was vegan even came around the bakers case. Scone was perfect.

Urban Beans does a nice job at lunch.  We enjoyed a bowl of lentil soup with some great toasted ciabatta bread and a salad.  They let the beans shine through with just a hint of onions, potatoes and carrots.  Very tasty and healthy.
24 hour coffee shop with free wifi and good coffee? YES. Perfect for getting out of the house for that all nighter essay or cramming session.

I visited friends for a weekend and before setting off to explore Phoenix, coffee was the first thing we wanted. My friends spoke highly of this place and I didn't see any reason why I should give it a whirl.   I ordered their Iced Horchata with two shots of espresso. Now, growing up I wasn't a fan of horchata, prior to my visit here, I wasn't sure where I stood with it still. I am here to declare that I've developed a liking.   The horchata is made in house, how would I know? I tasted the rice that had gathered at the bottom of my cup. It was delicious and it gave great texture to my drink. The cinnamon and seasoning were just right and not overwhelming. As an added bonus, frozen mango cubes were sprinkled on top! On a very hot Arizona day, chewing on a frozen fruit helps!   They displace their pastries and food in a well kept case. And their condiment bar is very organized. The decor is eclectic. It has an organized, home feel to it. The tables and chairs are miss-match but it works. There is a table with a chess set which I always find awesome! They have a restroom that is co-ed. Their patio area is cute and has plenty of shade! The entire place looks neat and clean!  Parking wasn't an issue and there seemed to be plenty!   The staff is very helpful and friendly. They answered all the questions that were asked and they even helped my friend decide on a drink.   I am definitely visiting again!

I've been coming here for a while since I used to work down the street from Urban Beans. I fell in love with their iced chai tea latte. It's not watered down or flavorless like some of the other coffee shops. It's flavorful and yummy in my tummy with just the right amount of spices and herbs, the way chai tea is supposed to taste like. They also have a great patio to just sit back, relax, and read a book.

I recently moved to the Coronado neighborhood and was hoping to find a good alternative to my favorite Melrose coffee shop.  a friend told me about Urban Beans and how great it was.  I didn't make it in during the holidays, but I finally did yesterday.  The place is really spacious, bright, and inviting.  There are plenty of tables and chairs and it looks like a great place to study, read, or  hang out with a friend or two.  I ordered a cafe au lait to go.  The nice guy at the counter asked me what ratio of coffee-to-milk I wanted and what kind of milk I wanted.  While the traditional cafe au lait is equal parts coffee and steamed whole milk, I don't always want lots of coffee flavor, so I found it thoughtful that he asked.  The display case had lots of different goodies, and had I not just purchased some delectable creme brulee from Torched Goodness, I would have chosen a treat.  I have been told they also serve sandwiches and have some of the best hummus/veggie plates.  I'm really looking forward to trying that!  My heart still belongs to my old coffee shop, but I think I'm going to really enjoy stopping in at Urban Beans.  Hooray!

I feel like the decor and chairs need an upgrade but the food is great. They have pulled jackfruit sandwiches that are awesome along with a lot of other good sandwiches and salads. Their bread is really really delicious. I will say that the fruit smoothies were not good. They really did had no taste to them but the food makes up for that.

For a 24 hr place it was a very pleasant experience. The person at the front didn't notice me for a very, very, very long time... Ok, so it's not Starbucks. Then, I asked her about the pastries, and she's basically like "Well, is that what the tag says? I can't see it?" Ok the tag said just "dairy" and I found out those were their non-vegan selections... She turned it around and was lovely. The lack of a star is because I was expecting more food choices. The outside seating was nice and clean. I wasn't able to sleep and that place was somewhere to go and just write and think. If I was vegan, I would have probably stayed longer and had plenty of food choices. I have vegan friends who struggle so I see what it feels like.

Breakfast sandwich was terrific with a mimosa which I believe had muddled raspberry? Capuccino has cinnamon sprinkled on top which I don't really care for but otherwise it was good. I love supporting local businesses and this is worthy of support.
I've only had a chance to try their drink menu but that was all it took for me to fall in love! Everyone should try their mocha and next time I'm definitely grabbing a piece of quiche.

I've been here a few times and the food has been ok, but nothing to write home about.  The breakfast burrito + chorizo is always a good choice. Be aware it is vegetarian and not real chorizo.  Smoothies were OK and the iced coffee certainly gets the job. The big appeal to me is the fact that it's open 24 hrs.

Second time out of three that I ordered a breakfast burrito and it never got made. When I asked what was the problem, the cook said they never got my order. This happened TWICE out of 3 visits. I will never, ever, ever go there again. I would caution anyone else also, unless you have the patience of Gandhi.  That and the first time this happened, they said I never even ordered the food. Funny I got charged for it. I left passed off and said I would not go back. Shame on me. Had to go to Starbucks next door, not that good but at least they get the order.

This place is literally the worst. I live down the street and have been here twice and the staff never knows what they're doing. They told me they didn't have bloody mary's when I could actually see a bottle of bloody mary mix sitting on the bar. Then I had to tell the girl making me drink that bloody mary's are made with vodka. Another girl tried to give my boyfriend a beer that was literally have foam and ask if it was ok. The staff is so incompetent, I really don't think it's they're fault, but they obviously have received no training. I wish I hadn't given this place a second chance, I'm still waiting for my bloody mary and just want to leave. I never give 1 star reviews but this place really deserves it.

The caprese sandwich is fantastic. Highly recommend it. Also the side salad that came with was even great. Great atmosphere and staff polite. Cook made the sandwich right in front of you so you know what's in it. I am definitely going back!
Fun, relaxing place to catch up with friends, study, or just grab a sangria just  because. I love that they're open 24/7, especially being a student looking for quiet corners to study.

We were traveling through town and needed a place to eat that had healthy food. We asked www.healthycow.com and found the Urban Bean Cafe and Bar. It was homey while still being chic.. and the food was amazing. I loved the paintings and I found that there was people who were really involved with loving the food they served you. The Hazelnut Chocolate Chip Cookie was amazing... and I am sure there were more things to try in the case that were just as good. Love it and it comes highly recommended. peace

We have been here 4 times before and USED to find it a very comfortable place to hang out and eat.  Tonight we went and found the menu had changed...there were just a list of ingredients and a couple of coffee choices with a list of flavors syrups. It was painful to look at and we decided to just get the frozen vanilla coffee drink we have gotten before. After asking us if it was like a frappacino, the person behind the counter said she could try to make how to make it. We asked where the chessboard was ( we have played chess for hours there before), she told us it was outside. We found it in a heap thrown in a table, it was so dirty that it looked as if it had been sitting in a dump for months...and on of the pieces was missing. They were also playing rap music, dropping the n-bomb every other sentence...not a fit for anyone there. She came out with two drinks instead of one and told us she accidentally made more. They were downright awful, like black coffee ground with ice. We brought the drinks up and I told her that they were really poor, not sweet at all like before. She then exclaimed that she used too much ice, and she would make them over using more vanilla "pops". She had us taste them again and they were frothy and now tasted like nothing. We asked her when they changed the menu, she told us three days ago?!? She then proclaimed that we probably wanted a "vanilla smash, she also informed us that it used powder the make  it  sweeter... We left after we paid for the drink.... Doubtful on a return

My only complaint about this place is that the tables are wobbly. Should be easy to fix. Staff is generally friendly, albeit some are certainly more anxious to please than others. Variety of food and drinks is excellent, despite the fact that they are vegan. Haven't tried the wine bar.  Open 24 hours, and usually parking is readily available (which is not the case with the mini-center just across the street).
Decent espresso, good selection of drinks & food, friendly staff, priced a tad higher than other places. Great place to get some work done.

Ok, this was my first time here. The Joe is good and they are open 24-7. This is Vegan heaven. All of the menu is in that fashion. No meat here.   I can't  right a full review because I'm carnivorous and need my meat. This place is located in the middle of the Central Corridor and is a very welcoming establishment. It has a very granola feel to it. I might bike here again for coffee at some point. Put meat on the menu and I'll be back often. Cool art on the walls! Be cool hipsters!  #vino2 #vino2ultimate #vinosquared

Urban Beans is definitely a great find in Urban Phoenix. While this coffee shop makes its home on busy 7th street, the second I stepped foot inside, I forgot what was going on outside. Urban Beans has the perfect environment of independent coffee shop meets a clean and modern space with an eclectic touch. There's plenty of seating inside and out and they even have comfy chairs at the tables. Free Wii Fi and electrical outlets make this the perfect work space and the food and drink options make it the ideal one.   The iced coffee here is delicious and I was happy to learn that they have sugar free chocolate syrup which is far and few between! It is pricey though and was $5.04 for a large iced coffee. I would definitely be in trouble if I worked here too long and too much! But the coffee is good and the environment is even better so I will most definitely be back.

Was trying to decide what to do to kill an hour before the gym and yelped tea so that I could read my boom when this place popped up! I got the peach green tea ( has a creative name but I forgot already) and a yummy cinnamon scone. Will be back to try things out on the menu when I have time!

I Googled "24 hour coffee places" and this was one of 3 that came up for the entire valley. It was basically on my commute in so it worked for me. I pulled up to the place and it was well lit and inviting. I walk in and there are 2 employees inside who greeted me. I went to the counter to order my coffee and the lady was very nice. She asked what my name was and I gave it to her. She introduced herself as Amanda and asked if I had ever been there. I said it was my first time and they both thanked me for coming to check them out. I let them know that I probably would only be in about once a month because thats how often my job requires me to work in the middle of the night.   They said they had only been open 24 hours for about a week. I guess its lucky since I was desperate for my fix. My coffee was ready and they hooked me up with a cookie for ciming in to check them out so I thought that was pretty cool. The coffee was pretty good and Im wide awake now as I write this review! All in all it was great personable service (which unfortunately is somewhat rare these days) so I would recommend this place for all your caffeine and baked treat needs!   Oh also they didnt have stir sticks. They had regular tea spoons to stir my coffee as they were trying to be as green as they could so I respected that.   Give UB a chance!

Although the service was very good, the coconut milk cappuccino was the worst I have ever had in my entire life. The pizza pocket I had was mostly bread and although they claimed it came with marinara ( well seasoned!! ) it was not properly reduced to be that. The bread itself was under-baked and had a soggy bottom. You can use a rolling pin or even wine bottle with rubber bands to create an even level for the dough to create a consistent bake and avoiding the insanely thick bottom. Pizza should be GB&D always, even if you are going to reheat it, usually a good even brown will be fine, take it to European brown for reheat. I would reduce down that really tasty marinara a bit more, blend it with an immersion blender would be perfect.  As for the coffee, all about temperature control and time management. Such a fricken nice espresso machine. I have faith in y'all, make people understand how awesome you are. Just refine it a bit
This place is exactly what a local coffee shop in Phoenix should be.  Lots of sunlight, good iced coffee.  (Also, apparently, they serve wine!)

My two co-workers and I went to UB for lunch today after another local restaurant was completely busy. I used to go to UB a lot before my job relocated so I recommended we went there based on my previous experiences a couple of years ago.  We got there at noon and I ordered an omelet which included oven roasted potatoes and 3 basic ingredients. In addition I added a "premium" ingredient; cheese and ordered a small white chocolate mocha. My bill came out to around $16.00 which I thought was a little pricey. One of my co-workers order an English muffin and the other ordered an omelet as well.   At around 12:30 they both went to check on the order and were told they needed 10 more minutes to finish making our food. At 12:38, I went back to ask about our food which one of the guys was already placing it in his hands to take our orders to us. I asked him what took so long and he apologized and told me he was new and so was the cook. He then told me they were both left alone which delayed things. I was annoyed that it took so long because we had to be back at work at 1:00 but I didn't say anything more and sat down.  As I went to quickly eat my food I realized two things: Our oven roasted potatoes were missing and we had cold and wet scrambled eggs on our plate, not an omelet.  I went back inside and told the same guy that our potatoes were missing and he said: "I'm sorry, do you need them." to which I responded that I did not need them but I paid for them. He offered to have the potatoes made for us, however at this point we were already so late that I was concerned about the length of time it would take to have those out. He also offered me a refund which I explained to him that I appreciated the offer but I was not looking for free food and did not want to take money away from a small local business. I added that I was just frustrated with the situation and agreed to have the potatoes made to go while I ran back out to inhale my food. The cook came out about 5 minutes later and gave us the to- go boxes and apologized as well, stating they were both left alone and were new to the job.  I felt so bad for them because although I was not mean, they could definitely see I was very irritated. It was not their fault they were left there alone yet they were the ones that had to listen to me vent. I hope that whoever manages these two employees takes the time to properly train them before leaving them alone. The place was not busy at all which makes me wonder what they would've done under even more pressure of having more people to serve. Needless to say, I was late, the food had no taste and it was pricey. I left very disappointed from this place.
Came in for the first time this morning and was amazed! The dirty chai was really good! Ill def be back here next week.

Coffee is great and pastries are delicious. I will stop by for some lavender cake to get my sweet fix. I probably would not go out of my way to go here if I didn't live close by. Its within walking/biking distance for me so its the best option. The staff is a bit sleepy and sometimes forgets my order but they are always really nice about it when I remind them.  Im not to hot about their bar since the first time I went and was served corked wine, and then continually served corked wine till we both got frustrated and I just ordered a beer. To be fair, the wine had been sitting out on the counter in a Phoenix summer. It is a nice place to work and get good coffee and pastries. I have not ordered any mixed drinks at the bar or tried their happy hour.

Totally disappointed. Hot latte and espresso brownie. Both were sub-par. No foam whatsoever on latte. Barely lukewarm too. Brownie had no espresso taste - or even chocolate for that matter. Place is messy and unappealing. Staff is busy talking to each other instead of customers. Sorry but if you want to play with the other true coffee houses in town ie. Press, Cartel or Echo you'll have to up your game UB.

cupcakes!...this place is adorable and cozy with a roomy patio with quite a few tables and they serve hefenveisen....their staff is friendly and helpful...which we all commented "goes a long way in phoenix"...and if that wasnt fabulous enough...you can even bring your dog to the patio. they play movies projected onto the outdoor patio wall and short leash dogs was there that nite...they closed at 8 so i didnt get to try any dogs but my dog had a fabulous time! woohoo- as good as it gets...they even have a lot of parking along both sides of the building...all n all...a win win of a spot!

Had to wait over 1/2 hour to get food.  Food was good but small portions and not what I expected to get. Coffee ran out, so I was shorted coffee. Staff was inattentive.   Very cool atmosphere except for staff.
I like the ambiance it comes with, you can either sit out side or stay inside and just relax. the coffee is great! great alternative to Starbucks!

The coffee is great but the real winner are the scones at Urban Beans. Most scones I have tasted from coffee shops are dry and a bit chalky but Urban Beans has perfected the art of the "scone". They are moist and savory yet sweet. My favorite is the pear, brie(?) or gorgonzola (?) I highly recommend it for a quick on the go treat.

You know, Ive come to Urban Beans many times in the past and it was great. Send my hubby to grab food today and wow! What a disappointment. I had an egg sandwich which the egg was overly peppered and grey. Gross, which is too bad because the english muffin was really good. The fruit salad was also gross, the strawberries were brownish and transparent and the cantaloupe was mushy and mealy too. Also had a yogurt parfait with granola and there was 2 tablespoons max of yogurt and the rest of the cup was granola! Its supposed to be the other way around. Disappointing because I wanted to support a local business, but I cant wait for the Starbucks to open now!

Very disappointed in this place. First off, I waited exactly 3 minutes  and 23 seconds before I was acknowledged (and  yes, I timed it) For a place that seems pretty prideful in food options online, the 'cook' didn't seem terribly concerned or knowledgable in what was in the featured item of the day. (Jack fruit tacos) I asked what all went in it before I ordered she literally shrugged at me and looked up at the menu for clues. The girl who rang me up mentioned to her 'we you should know since you're gonna be making it if she orders it.'  Another disappointment, I wanted to order a raw juice, I asked if it was possible to get just carrot and ginger, she said 'they're premade cause if you've owned a juicer, you'd know they're a bitch to clean.' ...I'm okay, so you're not willing to make something I can have just because the equipment is a hassle for you to clean?  Moving on, since I couldn't have anything else, I opted for lemonade...tastes like watered down minute maid...the jackfruit tacos we're okay,...but left me hungry again an hour later...for $11.95...I'd hoped to be full a little longer..  Overall, for being 'vegan friendly' ...allergens don't seem to be a priority here...gluten free options seemed to be next to nothing which was a bit of a let down. Perhaps I had higher expectations from seeing such high reviews on this place, but I don't think I'll be returning to a place where the workers make you feel like you're an inconvenience to serve.

Big piece of plastic bag in the food? What is wrong with vegetarian/vegan places in Phoenix? I really start to think anything marked vegan here will get high ratings just because they look trendy/fancy. This place has super slow service. Waited 10 minutes for the two staff try to open a wine for a customer, just so to make an order. Jackfruit was obvious leftovers. The staff tried to reheat from whatever left and sitting in a pan for who knows how long, and they were still cold when I got them. Dried bread and tiny little fillings. And I found a big piece of plastic bag in the sandwich!!!! See the pictures. And it's $10!!! Disgusting place! Only second time here and I swear I will never ever return to this place again. I really lose my trust in vegetarian/vegan place in Phoenix. Like this place, so overrated and they are just not even decent. Please be warned.
Sorry, did not like the food.  Besides the fact that it's waaay to expensive it's just not that great.  Coffee got me sick to my stomach from all the flavoring they put in it.  Not for me.

Cue the circus music.   Here's the deal; the staff are epic. Talented, communicative, fun, friendly, inviting, worthy of mass praise across the board. There are few coffee shops in phoenix that offer a non-pretentious experience, that also happen to employ logic based staff who operate with an above average level of competency. It's impressive to find this in PHX, let alone at a 24 hour spot. The staff get 5 HUGE Stars, no doubt.  ...and they make the best MF'ing Jackfruit Breakfast Burrito this mouth has ever masticated, courtesy of Chef-God Ivan the Great. If you don't know what Jackfruit is, get your ass in here and nom your way to a quivering mouth-gasm.  Latte's are on FLEEK by the always impressive Super-Brenda, and so is the wi-fi speed - which is never slow, even when the place is stacked with the always entertaining, caffein saturated college crowd. I really can't say enough about the return on investment from an employee & food/drink standpoint. You won't find better in PHX - especially at 2am.   So why 1 Star? Because despite how exceptional many of the staff are, the owners clearly have no concept of what effective business leadership requires. Their staff operate from a dwarfed position of generalized disenfranchisement. Spend 10 minutes with any of them and you can see how unappreciated, neglected, and overall, undervalued they are. We see this in the way they are treated, the lack of resources that they are provided with to make the UB experience what it really COULD be, lack of time-off, open all holidays (which is BS), etc.   This is not information that the employees disseminate, but after talking with most of them at length, and witnessing the truth of it from the "customer" perspective - over the course of weeks of 1st person exposure, the truth becomes evident - pissing off us loyal customers.  As a multi-business owner, I understand that there is nothing more critical for business success than employee satisfaction. When your employees feel valued, and appreciated, they become the most influential mouthpiece a company can ever hope to have - worth their weight in gold.   The fact that Urban Beans' owners do not recognize this - illustrated by the sheer number of AWESOME, yet broken-down employees Urban Beans employs - is infuriating for those of us who respect the work these hustlin' folks produce - in the trenches, building the Urban Beans brand with every new customer who walks through the door.   Having been to Urban Beans dozens of times over the past several months, my wife and I feel privileged to have had the opportunity to get to know many of the great staff here. As much as I don't want to support UB ownership, I cannot imagine NOT supporting their employees, who make the brand what it is. They are the lifeblood, the heartbeat of the UB experience. Without them, UB is nothing more than another failed, vacant commercial property, skid marking the Phoenix landscape.   So, to re-cap:   *Crappy ownership *Failed management *Talented (yet undervalued) chefs & baristas  *MF'ing EPIC Jackfruit Burritos *Dope ass latte's *Favorable wifi *Casual, friendly, non-pretentious environment *Open 24 hours  ...and can I just say, WTF is with all the damn FISH art all around the place? As a visual artist, I appreciate all expressions of creativity, but enough is enough.   Well done UB employees, for rising to the occasion, despite all the obstacles that are constantly being placed in your way. Mad respect. ((Hat Tip))  UB owners/managers - get a fu#!ing clue. Business management 101, take care of your staff.

I'm giving this place two stars for the fact that they are open 24 hours. It is so hard to find a place to hang out late at night with friends. My sister and I decided to give Urban Bean a try. We drove 25 mins to reach our destination and the minute we got there we were having doubts. The place was small and could use some updating with their decoration. They had a nice patio area to sit and hang out which I loved, but the seats were kindda dirty so we weren't comfortable sitting on it. The staff were nice and friendly, so I will give them credit for that. We must of caught them on a bad night because their oven was down and most items were out, so we couldn't order any food. The only thing that we could order was the hummas dish which we regret. It was $8 but was cold and dry, not very appealing at all. The drinks however was not so bad. We left this place feeling very disappointed and a waste of gas driving there.

This is my favorite place to get coffee in the Valley. The flavor is bold and every single food item I've tried is delicious. The location is central so it is convenient to meet up with friends that live all over Phoenix. I highly recommend Urban Beans!

Once again, my quest to steer clear from corporate or chain coffee has led me to a pleasant surprise!  This place isn't nearly as hipster as I expected. In fact, it was calm, mostly quiet, relaxing, friendly, and most of all inviting, which is kind of the exact opposite of a hipster coffee shop (I still love you Lux don't worry). It was a bright and airy late morning, with a jubilant gentleman playing acoustic guitar.   I ordered a cold brew, which was delicious. Their pastries are good, too. The vegan brownie was light and tasty, and my friend totally loved her scone. We'll be back to try some more of the fuller breakfasts.   Apparently, they've got some craft draughts in the afternoon, so I can see this as a place to have a quick pint on a warm afternoon. It's a bit small, but with great atmosphere, kind staff, and good products, so I'll certainly return!

Came for brunch and a cup of expresso jo. Omg not so good. Weak jo and the food took exactly 38 minutes to show. I was so ready to go by then. The bathroom door opens to the small little seating area -- which was dirty by the way -- and the rest of the place looked shabby too. I checked in my food to see when it'd arrive, and I wasn't treated to well. (I wish I cud have taken back my tip!) When my California wrap came out, it was in a white tortilla when I was told it was corn. What they did was take it back, dump oit half the filling and give me two cold tortillas with cold filling. So unappealing. Needless to say, I'm not impressed and I don't think I'll be back. Sad meal and a waste of my time and dollars.
Great coffee, friendly service, and good food.

I've been on a coffee quest lately and popped in here for an Americano and a brownie the other day. They had a line going so it was a wait: A. to put in my order; and B. to get my order. Fortunately I was not pressed for time so this wasn't a deal breaker for me on this particular day.  Strange that as soon as my order arrived, the number of staff went from two to four-things went much more smoothly after this. Maybe it was dead and two people went on break and five minutes later a crowd came in. Who knows and like I said, not a deal breaker. I enjoyed my Americano and the man who waited on me heated my brownie, which was a nice touch. The place reminds me of a cafe I used to hit when I was in Buenos Aires so it made me feel nostalgic. Just a touch of European flavor mixed in with great local products. Truth be told, I probably I like the atmosphere here more than what I consumed. I have to say that  the Espresso at Lux is THE BEST in The Valley and nothing, including Urban Beans, has come close. But as I've seen myself saying a lot lately, this is no reason not to check these guys out. In addition to coffee, they have pastries, smoothies, sandwiches and other cafe fare. I also like the wine bar which I may need to visit in the near future. One of their best features is the patio which will be a great place to enjoy a brew or a glass of vino. So I like the place and I will be back.

I love living in Phoenix and having my rotation of spots to hit each week, UB is one of the coffee shops I hit on my way to work. Not my favorite, but by all means in the top five. It's clean, well stocked, well lit, and certainly gets me fueled for the day. I don't mind that the prices are slightly higher than some of my other coffee stops, esp now that Starf*cks is next door, in fact I have bumped UB up on my rotation as a response to that terrible chain being so close, I want to do my part to help them out. A good, quick cup, and fantastic baked goods are always available. I dig this spot, and wish them the best! One of these evenings I need to stop by for a beer, been meaning to do so...

Let me start off by saying that this place is EXPENSIVE! It makes Starbucks look cheap compared to their prices. I got a SMALL iced coffee for almost $5. Even Starbucks is cheaper! The coffee was just an average ice coffee flavor like the one you can get at McDonalds for $1.49 (medium size) but they are a rip off! Plus they have horrible customer service. When I was in line there was one person in front of me and it was not busy at all, but they took forever taking his order and there was two people helping him and they weren't even helping him they kept on laughing and talking about random stuff, as if they were friends, which I truly don't care but it was an inconvenience because I had to wait 5-10 minutes for just 1 person in front of me. They didn't even greet me say "hello, good morning, we will be with you in a minute" NOTHING! They both saw me and I had my wallet in my hand and staring at both of the workers who were just chatting with the person in front of me who was most likely a friend. (I could tell by there conversation.) to indicate that I am ready to order, but nope I waited 5-10 minutes just for them both to acknowledge me and say "what can I get for you?" Not even a "sorry for the wait". Also it was my first time going in so I asked what she recommends and she said "everything's good" ok... Um thanks for your recommendation.. NOT. I then asked her what kind of iced coffee they have and she answered with a rude/ angry "all that you can think of" Just no help at all. There menu is not even readable and it's just crazy that they even have semi-decent reviews on Yelp because they do NOT deserve it. Plus the tables were dirty and they had no clients! I was NOT impressed at all. Save your money!! & Pass this place it really is nothing special. I will NEVER return and will make sure my friends and family don't ever stop at this place.

Went this morning for coffee and scones with my toddler. The scones were amazing and my vanilla latte was delicious.  I didn't see any highchairs which is always a bummer when I'm out with the little one.  I had a hard time hearing the cashier as it was a little too loud and we were the only ones in there. The customer service was average but again the food and drinks were awesome. I will most likely stop in again.

This review is only for the environment and coffee. Did not try any of the food but the coffee was pretty meh.  There was a lack of flavoring options that I am used to. And they didn't put much ice in my iced coffee so by the time I sat down it was already melted and wasn't cold more like luke warm. The environment was very unique with a cute patio with unique furniture.  Was a nice day out so sat outside. Was very cool and they had potted plants. Probably won't come again but wasn't bad either. Could see it as a cool hang out place with friends.

I REALLY wanted to give this place a good review, but I just cannot. Once again, this is a charming little spot in my area that ive drove by a thousand times and never stopped in. After waking up at the god awful hour of 6am on a Saturday (garbage I know lol), I decided to drag my half awake self over here for some breakfast. My mom had given me a coupon from her entertainment book for a bogo deal.   First impression from the outside, cute. I like the mismatched furniture outside. And since it was cool enough out this past weekend, we were able to sit out there and not roast. It kind of went downhill from there, sadly. When we walked in, there were more employee's than customers, and we were not greeted with even a hello. That bugged me. Second, the menu was very underwhelming. Since both my son and I are picky, we stuck with simple items. I got the potato cheese and egg burrito, he got the egg and cheese English muffin and a blackberry lime scone. The scone was actually very good, the other items were just okay. I also ordered a hot chai latte and a cold horchata for the little one. Those were good as well.   Overall, I was just very unimpressed with the place. The prices are reasonable, great location, but other than that, there is nothing that makes me want to come back here.
Cold brew was very smooth and of course strong! I think it was better than Starbucks! Great place to chill, relax and work on homework!

Great products, but they seem to be out of stuff often and or their reward point machine is down.  Frustrating when you pass 50 other places you could have stopped at.  About the third time now fir this situation.

The coffee and food is really good!! I'm excited about their vast options for vegans, and the inside is really pretty. It's also great that they're 24 hours, so if I want to come by late at night to catch up on some homework or something, I can. However, there is this one girl that works there (blonde short hair, piercings) that is incredibly rude. Both times I've been in i've seen her be rude to her coworker(s), be short with other customers, and be rude to my mom and I. It's just kind of a bummer, since it is such a nice place.

I love this little cafe. It's close to home, serves food that is consistently amazing, and makes a fantastic dirty chai.  Nathaniel and Amanda can pretty much anticipate my order now that I've become a regular and always greet me with a smile. They obviously are passionate about what they do and that's refreshing!  Some mornings can be a little crazy: professionals with laptops and cell phones abuzz. If that's not your speed, wait till around 9am or try another day. I often see students studying here as well. :)

Daisy made an awesome Italian bake! Daisy was also super helpful and knowledgeable about the menu. Thank you for me delicious vegan calzone/bake it was the perfect thing after a long work day! I absolutely loved the patio/outdoor seating space.

Yum!  First visit today and I was deff impressed.  Tried the chai and a potato quiche.  Chai wasn't bad, quiche was delicious.  Prices are right at what you would expect for a cute coffee house.  Vibe was very relaxed.  Can't wait to come again and try some of the other good, and check out the wine!

I stopped in here for a coffee date with a girlfriend to catch up on gossip. Neither of us had been here before but UB is located on 7th street/thomas so it was a good location for both of us. She got a nonfat latte, I got a cappuccino. I chose the larger size for something like .50 more. Holy huge mug. I'm not kidding- I could not fit my 2 hands around this mother. It had 4 shots of espresso and was more than impressive. I think it cost me $4.00 total. The coffee was good, but I preferred Lux & Lola back in the day for coffee. Anyway, my friend and I split some sort of chocolate hazelnut torte dessert. It was dry and poor tasting. The fresh raspberry sauce on the top gave it some redemption, but it was not worth the calories or money. Overall, our bill was $13.00 which was a little pricey for the quality & lack of freshness of the torte. The atmosphere was quite nice, however. Coming for the atmosphere alone would be worth it. I suspect the other desserts in the case were  better than the one I got based on other reviewers feedback. They also have a cute, cozy patio right out front with strings of lights, plants and nice seating. In nice weather, it would be a great hangout spot. I'll return and try a different treat next time. I enjoy supporting local business and this place is a cute keeper.   Worthy to note- I also saw the workers there writing some sort of Happy Hour menu up on their big white board- something like 4-7 Monday thru Friday....? I have no idea what was on there but this place would be a great HH place to unwind with a few co-workers if you aren't into the bar scene.   Other thing to note- park in the lot SOUTH of the bldg, it is much larger and easier to get into/out of. The lot north of the bldg is crowded with spaces packed in like sardines. Good place to get your car dented/scratched.

Get Your PHX got me here for my second visit yesterday and I'm glad they did!  Two months ago they built a bar in the place, serving craft beer and select wine.  They'll soon have a full dinner menu as well.  We packed the house for a free wine pairing [I know it's a small business and know how much Virginia Senior, proprietress sacrificed] on their regular 'BU Thursday' wine pairing event - a mere $15 normally.  Virginia, at least for me, your sacrifice will not have been in vain - you've secured 2 new regular customers!  The sommelier's discernment shined brightly and the chef's pairing choices were competent and then some - I rarely get the 'frisson' I experienced in the Queso Manchego paired with the 2008 Edge Cabernet.  You won't regret showing up next Thursday for their weekly wine pairing.

This was a cute place, just down from Starbucks and a nice alternative. I got a cappuccino- the espresso flavor was strong and the foam was perfect. It has a nice seating area outdoors and plenty of parking.

They only reason I didn't give this place 5 star is there portion of food I tried the raco tacos and was so disappointed 10$ and there was barely anything I'm a small girl and I was left wanting to buy somthing else over priced to eat I understand vegan food is difficult to make while still tasting delicious but I just felt ripped off....How ever the coffee I have a dozen times and it is AMAZING! i will have to try something else on the menu and give another chance plus the atmosphere and environment  here is very comfortable and welcoming

Went here hoping for some pie and they were out. Actually they had very little selection of anything. Still searching for that place where you can go out and get dessert (like pie). This place was not it.

Urban Bean is simply delicious! I can't seem to stop gushing about this place because the food is amazing. Its upscale taste at a reasonable cost.  I must admit that the only disappointment I had about this place was that more people weren't there to discover the tastiness of their food. I had a Pear and Arugula dish and the goat cheese, pesto, and sun dried tomatoes dish. Both made me mouth happy. Overall this place is adorable and the staff including the owner are helpful and friendly. I'd suggest that all of PHX go to this place and enjoy.

I love this coffee shop! They have excellent service and they have delicious coffee! They also have a fantastic almond latte! I have tried any of their baked goods but they look delish! This coffee shop is also environmentally friendly! Their coffee lids are made from cornstarch and plastic ware is made from potato starch, they dissolve in compost in so many days...So this coffee shop is a must stop for the neighborhood!

Was so excited to try this place and sadly, was disappointed. I had the roasted vegetable sandwich. They forgot the cheese and when I sent it back it returned cold with the cheese not melted. The sandwich was okay. I've had better roasted vegetable sandwiches at many places. And for $10 it was just a sandwich, no sides.  The place itself left a lot to be desired. Crowded, uncomfortable and no ambience.   Not a place I would go back to which is a bummer because I'm always looking for new vegan/vegetarian options.

Nice little breakfast spot to come to. It is a vegetarian place but they have some items on the menu that are vegan or can be made vegan. I came and there was a line so I assumed it was going to be pretty good. It was a spacious and clean building, good seating area and they provide wifi.   I ordered to dine in and I got the #1 burrito which had potatoes, pinto beans, and chipotle sauce and I added spinach and mushrooms. Food got to me pretty quickly and it was so good that I make my own version of it at home now! The only downside was that they didn't have that many vegan dessert options, but what more can you really expect if you go to a vegetarian place?   Workers were friendly and helpful since it was my first time going there. Definitely recommend it to anyone who is looking for a chill place to enjoy breakfast in the downtown Phoenix area.

My friend and I came here because it was late and we were both craving matcha lattes. Happened to pass by and decided to give it a try. The cafe itself is very cute and I like how it is open 24 hours. The drinks were also pretty good (aside from being more room temperature than hot). However, the customer service that was received was not top notch. My friend got her drink right away, mine ended up being forgotten and I waited about 20 minutes for it. When I asked about it they didn't even know my order and told me someone else must have taken it even though nobody else had ordered drinks. I do appreciate them giving me a bigger size for the mistake, but I am not sure I will be returning.

I was pumped to see that there was a 24 hour vegan coffee shop not far from where I live, but this place was disappointing. All the tables in the patio area had food residue or bird poop on them, and there were a bunch of plates that clearly had been sitting there a while and had flies swarming around. It felt gross and dirty. The drink that I ordered was bland and watery and they no longer serve the burritos and tortas that are listed on the menu online - just a random selection of pastries and some jackfruit calzone type thing.

I love Urban Beans! It is probably one of the best coffee houses I have been to. The staff members are great and there is plenty of seating and lots of plugs for computers. The WiFi is very reliable! Can't wait for the weather to get a little warmer so I can have coffee on the patio!

I'm a gluten-free vegan who usually has to eat vegetarian because of available options. But this place is all vegan, all the time. They usually have something GF in the pastry case as well, which means I'm in cafe heaven. You're not up-charged for non-dairy milk because that's all they carry. It's fantastic to patronize somewhere that has the same values I do.  I've been there many times, as it's a hot spot for the local live theater scene. This last weekend I had a lavender iced latte with soy milk and I was in heaven. I enjoyed it on the spacious patio and chatted with my sister. It was quiet perfection in the heart of sprawling Phx. N. Burns, the owner, is friendly and kind and a great supporter of the arts and his community. You can see this by the people he hires as well. They are all polite and informative and don't seem to mind when you take a few extra minutes to decide between the mixed berry GF scone or the GF apple muffin.  And they certainly don't judge you when you decide to have both.  This is a great place for a first date, a friend catch-up, or a pre-show drink. (YES! They have vegan cocktails and they are AMAZING!)

Three stars for being open 24 hours, but one star for coffee.  Went in with a friend for what we were hoping to be an enjoyable after dinner coffee.   We ordered two hot mochas and it was probably the worst coffee drink we have ever had. The guy working was obviously new. Okay, not a big deal normally, but this guy didn't know anything. I should have known it was going to be a disaster when he asked how much mocha syrup went into my drink.  In the end it tasted like watered down brewed coffee with no mocha flavoring at all. Where was this guy's training? Two mochas $11 and change. Very disappointing!  Also a bit annoyed that they do not offer decaf!   I like to support local, but I probably won't be back here. There is a great 24 hour coffee shop just up the street on Camelback.

Great coffee + occasional live music + wine bar + fun art and style = 5 stars!  Urban bean really increases my love for Phoenix. If you come at the right time, just sitting with your coffee and enjoying the ambiance is very euphoric.  YOU MUST TRY: 1. The wine bar 2. Joyous almond smash 3. Smash me s'more 4. Dark chocolate mocha smash

Coffee is great, but the AM service is painfully slow. One person to take orders and make orders just doesn't cut it. 20 mins for one drink? I want to ditch Starbucks across the street and make this my go to spot, but unless they can get their AM service figured out, it's just not going to cut it.

There is something to be said for being able to roll out of  bed at any hour and grab a vegan burrito. Even better when it's really good. Even better when the folks that work there (Kristin, I'm looking at you) are buckets of fun to talk to. This place serves food 24/7 and has great beer on tap. You really can't lose.

For a coffee joint there is a surprisingly large amount of space.  Local art lines the walls (and it's for sale), a few locally made items such as coffee cup cozies are also available.  I was happy to find that along with a gorgeous array of pastries ranging from vegan chocolate torte to chocolate pecan pie, there was also an assortment of breakfast and lunch items.  Not only does Urban Beans feature a Sunday Brunch with Omelet bar every Sunday, but there is a wonderful assortment of breakfast items to be enjoyed.   Farm egg sandwiches on toasted english muffins, Market quiche, granola parfait, scones, and even gluten free vegan english muffins.  Furthermore, lunch selections boast a fabulous spread of sandwiches such as the turkey, brie, cranberry sandwich with a fabulous mango cranberry chutney and fresh arugula.  For the salad selection I highly recommend the quinoa mediterranean salad with mini tomatoes, persian cucumbers, feta cheese, fresh mint, and their citrus house vinaigrette.  A more esoteric selection on the menu is the pear and arugula melt, with fresh pears, arugula, fontina cheese, and a balsamic raspberry reduction.  Average price of a sandwhich is about $8, salads and quiches range from $4.50-$7.50.  Melts are about $8-$9.    I have only sampled the Chai latte here, which I thought was beautifully rendered.  Coffee and espresso drinks are abundant here, prices are very reasonable.  Great lunch spot, perfect for browsing the internet with their free wi-fi on a lazy sunday.

First impression:  Coming in i didn't like the parking lot the entrance closet to the building is actually the exit. When I get in two people are waiting come to find they haven't been helped yet. The staff seems to move slow and seems slightly depressed. The food is vegetarian but good. The coffee is good, I had a ice coffee macchiato. It was delicious. Went around 3pm and it wasn't crowded but they are open 24 hours. Will have to try a different time to verify if they are just slow or if it was the time of day.
Good drip coffee and pie, staff is avg. WiFi fast and free. Comfortable seating, pleasant ambient noise.
Love this joint! Great coffee and the apple pie is on point. I also love that this spot is 24 hours. Night or day, this place definitely wins.

Fantastic lunch at a great price - all the right ingredients blended perfectly together and the obviously homemade sauce, which for me either makes or breaks an Italian dish, is neither overpowering nor bland. This delightful marinara accents the cheesy vegetable blend making this lasagna to die for!  And at $6.50 the word will spread quickly. I love the atmosphere here and keep being surprised at the interesting dishes they continue to offer.

I've been a regular at Urban Beans through all of its phases...uno, duo and tertio.  The addition of wine and beer has been a welcome surprise.
