We stop for coffee, iced drinks and for happy hour...and never been disappointed. Whatever you do, do not try the toffee...if you do, you will become addicted.  The staff is always friendly, the baked goods are as good as you'll find anywhere and the atmosphere is what a coffee house should have.  Landscaping and patio are well done and comfortable...despite being along 7th street, you can carry on a conversation there and be comfortable.

urban beans how I do love thee.  the espresso shots are pulled to perfection and i've never had a bad drink out of the 20 or so i've had so far here. the pastries and sweet treats are delicious. the toffee is to die for. the muffins make me melt. the tabouli and hummus are delish. the bagels are fresh. the goat cheese torte made me lick the plate clean. their smash drinks are amazing and i'm partial to the s'mores one. better than dutch bros sweet coffee treats. hands down.  the best part is that everything in here is locally made and environmentally friendly.  from the cups which are made from corn and totally compostable to the friendly, down to earth staff that makes the place a truly great coffee spot. so many other coffee joints in the area want to claim they are local and environmentally friendly and blah blah blah, but really, the most they can lay claim to is that their coffee comes from somewhere in AZ. virginia, the owner, really prides herself on obtaining everything in the places from locales. with all the coffee options out there, make urban beans your first choice.

Great setting. Great coffee. excellent scones of various fresh berries of the season. My biggest disappointment -the building is dirty .  the bathroom floor  was filthy. clean the patio  too . a little housekeeping would go a long way
This place is a must for late night study sessions, coffee, great times with friends, and chess! Employee with beard is the nicest!

Open 24 hours! Need I say more! They also have a little wine bar area. Perfect for a study session, a cup of coffee, or a glass of wine. They have light meal options, and desserts! The coffee is fire! A strong cup of coffee which I love, but not all can handle! Centrally located, which makes it accessible, whenever you need to stay up!

OMG what a super tasty meal! I had the scrambled eggs (tofu) fried potatoes and Chipotle burrito and it was heavenly. I split a vegan chocolate cupcake with my sister and if I died at that moment it would have been total vegan bliss and I would die with a huge satisfied smile. All my friends are gonna love this place with it's awesome staff, relaxed and beautiful atmosphere. Food is reasonably priced and delicious.

Cute! I love another independent coffee shop in my neck of the woods. The people working there were friendly, but not ingratiatingly so. The menu and prices - on par with other coffee shops. I had to try something to eat, but none of the baked goods had mad shelf appeal. I went for the cardamom coffee cake, which looked about as exciting as burnt white toast. Appearances are deceiving! A sweet, milky vanilla-caramel cake with a thick ribbon of dense, concentrated cinnamon based spice running throughout, all with a thin and barely perceptible glaze on top. Yum yum yum! A little greasy and so definitely not on my every day meal plan, but this will serve nicely for a treat every now and again.   The coffee is average, but I'm no coffee snob. (I am baffled by those who suggest the barista should "learn to pull a good shot". WTF?) It's not Starbucks-burnt, so it works for me.   The girl working there (I assume one of the owners) said Fox 10 News was out there yesterday morning, doing a remote report. Cool! I hope it brings them lots of business. It's a good location, in a little strip mall that also has an Aveda salon (who knew?), and just a little out of my way in the mornings. Oh yeah, and they were actually open when I got there a little after 6:30. What's up with coffee shops that don't open until 7 (or later!!!)? I will definitely be adding Urban Beans to my list of morning coffee sources.

Decided to go here instead of my usual place and I was very satisfied. Had something simple, hazelnut latte, but it was very good and the atmosphere was pleasant as well. Look forward to trying their breakfast next time I go.

I was able to visit this hipsterish wifi café on two separate occasions after reading so much about it on Yelp. The horizontal interior has good natural lighting, a front pastry counter, arrangement of tables and high chairs to the left, and a wine bar to the right. Noise level is high, and the clientele includes laptop dwellers, students, and group gatherings.  Kale and Roasted Beets Salad ($9): A good serving of fresh kale, walnuts, goat cheese, roasted beets and red pepper vinaigrette. The composition was tasty, as the mix of creamy goat cheese, crunchy walnuts, fresh beets, and firm beets were delightful. I had this salad on both visits. Quality can be inconsistent between visits, as the kale was slightly yellow on the first try and overdressed and saltier yesterday. I'm likely to try the Quinoa Salad before coming back to order this dish again.  Pear and Arugula Melt ($9): Flat bread layered with fresh pears, arugula, fontina cheese, and dressed with balsamic raspberry reduction. This item is no longer available on the menu, but the inconsistent firm and softness in the flat bread struggled, and the sour balsamic raspberry reduction didn't mix well with the pear. The café will jumpstart a new menu soon, so hopefully the flatbread will be much improved if it's scheduled for a return.  Soy Dirty Chai Latte ($6.34): The latte was sweet with a solid hint of strong espresso and noticeable chai. The price was steep because they penalize diners for the use of soy--even though there is not a whole lot of differentiation to the cost of milk in the supermarket. This was one of the better dirty chai lattes, but also not worth the price.  Green Peach Ice Tea ($2.50): The ice tea was light and refreshing. The mix of green tea and subtle peach flavor was nicely balanced.   Service was personable but a bit snooty. They were very nice to let me sample the Garbanzo Soup and my drinks came out quickly. However, the password for their wifi was "thankyou" and my colleague and I were both offended by it. Overall, it was a pricy but convenient place for laptop users and group gatherings.  I'd be interested in coming back to see if their new menu will be any better.
The chocolate chip pear scone was amazing! Also recommend the breakfast burrito #3.  So good that while on vacation we ate here two days in a row!  Staff was amazing. Definitely recommend.
Excellent place to hang out and have a coffee, beer, or glass of wine.  It's a great little neighborhood hangout spot.

This place is so great, the staff are all super friendly and helpful! They have tons of VEGAN options for food; salads, wraps/burritos, flatbreads, etc. and of course lots of delicious VEGAN desserts too...so amazing to be able to get yummy food 24 hours a day!!!! WIFI also!!! Inside seating & also outdoor patio seating!!!!

Food is all right, employees not so much. An employee by the name of Christina was swearing and I'm almost entirely sure it's because she's having a bad day. But I don't think it that kind of language should openly be used when it's obvious that there are customers within earshot. While I do realize that it's just the way some people talk, it does not set forth a professional environment.

I had the Jackfruit Carnitas Style Torta.. wow! I'm impressed! I haven't had a hand-held this worthy of praise in years. If everything vegan / vegetarian tasted this good, I'd never go back to eating meat.

Delicious food and amazing drinks! All vegan! My new favorite cafe. I've been here several times even though I just discovered it, and every time my drinks are made perfectly, and the staff is very friendly.

Got a small caramel toffee mocha and a red velvet cupcake. Also tried a bit of my friend's strawberry scone (she got the same flavour drink). The coffee was really good and smooth - not over roasted or too strong/weak and had a really nice sweet toffee flavour. The cupcake was a little more thick and cold than I prefer (I like my cake more fluffy/airy and room temperature) but was really good and not too sugary. The scone was definitely better, though. The only problem was that the coffees did take a long time to come out and it wasn't that busy, but there was only one barista and I didn't pay attention to the line length. Seems like a great neighbourhood spot, though. There was a live guitar player at the time which was kind of neat but strange on a Saturday morning.

I am amazed at how many stars this place has on here, but I am here giving it 3 as well.  I go to this place probably one to two times a week, a convenient location for me and stays open *24 hours.* I imagine it is that plus the young, granola vibe the place has to it that keeps its rating up. If you stop in here once or twice, the atmosphere and yummy vegan treats will probably keep you from seeing the major management issues that are evident to anyone who frequents or has frequented this place..  Every time (and I mean EVERY time) I go in here, there are new employee faces I've never seen before. Not only that, but last week's "familiar" faces are gone; I am very curious about the turnover rate here. Just as inconsistent as the employees, are the PRICES (I get the same order every time) ranging from $4 for both drinks, to $8 for both, to $10 or $11 sometimes.. it takes so long to get my drinks and order most of the time that I don't even bother to argue, plus I know it's only going to make things harder on the newbie of the day. The coffee tastes good usually, but I always have to make sure my espresso shot is added or that the drink is made right.   I feel bad saying this as most people working there are young and seem to really be trying; I know it's hard to learn anything when you are trained by someone who really still could use training..   Yet, this place is still very successful.  I've never eaten the cooked food, only the muffins or pastries, but the bakery items are usually delicious and healthy. The artsy feel of this place keeps people coming back in, especially the youngins. Like I said, I go back too, but would never go out of my way for this place and my boyfriend and I know it always takes at least 10 minutes to get our coffees here..

Overall, great coffee, great food!! Very friendly staff. I had the egg sandwich. Fresh eggs for sure. Cheese. Nothing special. It looked really tiny on the huge plate. Wife had the turkey sandwich. Very generous portion. She loved the soy latte. I had the strawberry smoothie. Pretty tasty.
Stop everything you're doing and go get one of their brownies, warmed up, with an ice cold glass of milk. I'll never be the same.

I decided to go in as it looked like a great place to relax and drink coffee, WRONGOOO I go in and no one acknowledges our presence a simple hello is fine as we are not royalty lol however I decide what I want, I am behind a couple... few moments later they are done but the waitress/cashier never noticed or made it seem like we were next... she goes under the counter starts looking for stuff I guess coffee filters or something.. took her a few to comeback and ring up my one pastry pear almond scone? ... anywho she sets it on the glass counter I swipe and no contact stilllllllll I wait for her to hand me my pastry .. never happens I grab it and say goodbye as a good bye was not given... that's not ALL I split the pastry with my mother and there is a hair!!!! Sooooo I will never buy or enter this facility. :)
What I like: the coffee, the patio, unpretentious atmosphere, and open all night. I've only been here once (on a late night coffee run) and I hope to return when I'm in the area.
Neat little place, quiet enough for a business meeting. Nice patio as well.

I loooooooooovvvveeeeee this place ! Their food is delicious and their staff is thee best !! I love the night crew (:  It's great vibes so makes it easy to keep coming back ! Shout out to Jackie for always taking care of me

Great neighborhood coffee shop right down the street from my house. I really like that you can come here any time of day and find something you're in the mood for. Good coffee, beers on tap and plenty of vegetarian/vegan options on the menu. I'm a huge fan of the scones and the tofu scramble. I showed up early when the scones were fresh out of the oven and oh man, super good. The service can be a little slow at times, but it's not a big deal if you plan on hanging out for a while anyway. If you're in the area, forget Starbucks and hit this place up instead.

This would be one of my favorite places. It opens 24/7!!!! It is the only place I have discovered so far that it's always open, considering Phoenix is a big city you would think there would be more right?...  Maybe I just haven't done my research. Yummy chai tea latte with almond milk!  They also have a bar, so if you feel like getting comfortable (wine, beer, bourbon, bailey's, etc) but at the same time do some work on your lap top totally possible!

I love to sit there with my drink and read my stuff. I am so comfortable to be there by myself for hours. Tables outside is nice. The plant in the pots are cute.  All smashes are awesome, especially the one with almonds.  Fruit cake is great (not too sweet)

So...I want to like this place due to the convenient location.  There were a couple of good experiences - coffee was pretty good, lentil soup was really good.  Service was 'meh'.  But the bad experiences were so bizarre, I don't think I'll be coming back.  1: In a hurry to pick up my sister from work, I stopped by to grab a to-go snack for the both of us.  Goat cheese/pesto/sundried tomato tart?  Sounds delicious!  It was delicious upon tasting it.  However, there were bits of *sharp* broken plastic lodged in the goat cheese, (which, by the way, I chewed on until I realized that it wasn't a really dry tomato, but in fact plastic).  I took a picture, then called to provide a friendly, "FYI - this happened.  I don't know how this happened, but you might want to investigate."  She was friendly enough, but incredulous, (are you sure this didn't somehow magically happen inside the closed to-go bag/box while you were driving?) - lending to the worry that nothing was done in terms of investigation.  I tossed the rest of it, (to the dismay of my hungry sister), for fear of destroying her insides.  2: Upon the next visit, (a week or so later), I stopped in to have the soup, since the lentil was great the last time I had soup here.  They didn't have the lentil, but they did have the roasted red pepper.  When I came to order, the guy at the counter informed me that they only had enough soup left for one cup, and that he wanted it.  I couldn't tell if he was joking, but after a long stare, he placed the order.  When I went to pay, he informed me that I wouldn't have to pay sales tax today because their 'system was down'.  Thanks?  That sounds...a bit unethical, but okay.  Soup finally came out, (was told the reason it took a while because there was work going on in the back).  Delicious, much like the lentil soup.  But as I was eating, I noticed the contractors working in the kitchen were on ladders doing something to the ceiling.  Above where the food is being prepared.   No bits of ceiling in the soup, thankfully.  But wow.  Like I said - very torn.  The food is great tasting, but I shouldn't have to worry about ingesting foreign objects upon each visit.
We love this hidden treasure in the heart of Central Phoenix. The artwork on the walls are really neat. The food is delicious and gluten free. The variety of teas are fabulous.
I know it's "local" but there's a reason the Starbucks just to the south is always more crowded. Not exactly the best Caramel Latte I've ever had. I've been here twice, both times I was underwhelmed.

Great coffee shop with great homemade baked goods and excellent espresso drinks and tea. I am here and have been here for 10 hours working, ate breakfast, lunch, and dinner, and had great internet access and service the whole time. Why you would go to Starbux when you have this across the street boggles my mind. If you hang out here for a while you will literally hear "I'm going to go make an apple pie" and similar such statements from the baristas. Plus, they were slow bringing me my lunch (I didn't care and was clearly here to stay) because they were roasting the tomatoes, so they brought me a free drink. Plenty of good seating, great wifi, a good outdoor patio, easy parking, clean bathroom, good art, and hip and good looking clientele of all ages. A little cold in temperature for me but probably good if you're coming in from the blazing sun. Just totally solid all around.
Urban Beans is great!   The best place in DTPHX for a Matcha Green Tea Smoothie. Plus, they Belly which gives you frequent buyer perks :)   Belly:  https://getbelly.com/

A practical visitor who is staying at a hotel is confronted with the following question each morning: "Is there something out there worth going to (and paying for!), or do I just resort to the hotel's complimentary breakfast?"  This place is worth going to--daily, if need be. They offer excellent coffee with a wide variety of creamer options, along with many light and tasteful breakfast items. We tried the "Mano Poblano", the "Farm Delux", and a brownie; we left satisfied.   They are open 24 hours--jet-lagged visitors from the East Coast won't have to wait for regular business hours.

I was in Scottsdale for a few days and tried two vegetarian restaurants. Urban Beans is far better in quality and taste than the other place (Green New American). The food is excellent. The ambiance like a coffeehouse that invites you to stay as long as you please. I tried the jackfruit carnitas club sandwich (minis the mayo) and my husband (non-vegetarian) had the southwest Caesar salad and said it was one of the best salads he's ever had. We loved it so much we had the same thing for lunch a couple days later.

I feel terrible for writing it a 3-star, but honestly I do not find their espresso or chai teas very good at all. Now, take a look at all the other reviews and people rave about it - so take it as you will, but I will not be returning here for the coffee/espresso. It's a serious bummout for me, because I like most everything else about this place.  However, they have a GREAT selection of loose-leaf teas that smell like heaven. And it's an awesome place to work from - tons of windows with plenty of sunshine and a great patio. You just have to ask for the wi-fi code.   The employees seem genuine and cordial, and I dig the fact that they have open mic nights and live music acts. I dig it as a cool joint to hang out at.  It's a decent location with parking that has never been full for me.   My favorite thing? They sell gluten-free goodies like biscotti and english muffins. Who knows if they rotate their GF selection, but I really appreciate any place that caters to my kind. AND it seems like they have a pretty big menu for a coffee house (like REAL food too).   Summary: coffee? Not my thing here. Tea? Yes, please. Working? Pretty decent. Gluten-free selection? They are trying and that's all that counts.

Great little eclectic coffee house, just down the street.  Prices were reasonable, seating was ample, and the drinks were spot on!  Free wifi is a nice touch.  Loved the outside area, though don't see that being utilized until winter.

Pros: Coffee is great.  Staff is awesome Location Parking space Open 24/7  Cons: Little pricey - both food and beverages compared to similar establishments Damn those chairs ad table. I'm 5'10 and no matter where I sit (at the bar or tables), I can't reach the table comfortably. I come a lot here for studying and I have to keep my shoulders in elevated position to reach the table. And definitely the chairs can be little comfortable

You killed it - ohhh nooo!!!  They used to make some of the finest Cafe Lattes in town (you know, latte = milk in Italian), but now they're all plant-based, and an espresso mixed with soy milk or almond milk is just awful

My wife called this morning to see if they would do a side of scrambled eggs. She drove all the way there and when She asked the lady upfront she said they don't do that. She then asked who I'm assuming is the manager and she said oh yeah I remember that call we can do that. My wife was super embarrassed. Then she came out to find that she had a flat tire due to the small entrance she hit the curb. I drove there and change the tire for her and I went into grab a water. The same lady charged me for a cup of water!!! Yeah we won't be back.

Great place, great location. Coffee is super good, NOT bright/hipster coffee. Ambience is super chill & mostly quiet during weekend mornings. I got a lot of work done. I like the varied seating options as I do come to work. I can sit or stand. I haven't had their food but it's great that they have a full menu.

I really wanted to like this place since I can walk there from my house in the morning, but both times I tried it in the morning the service was horrible. It was a guy the first time and he was either in a bad mood or having a bad day but he was very rude and actually forgot to make my drink I had to remind him once I realized he hadn't even started it (it wasn't even busy.) I was going to drink my drink and eat my scone there but the service was so bad I decided it would be better to walk home and enjoy it there instead. On the up side the vanilla latte was delicious and their scones were great! I just wish the service was friendlier  I went again trying to give it a second chance, but that time it was an older woman and she was distant as well and was having a conversation with another customer the whole time I was trying to order, it was a bit awkward and uncomfortable so I once again just walked home to eat instead of staying there.

You can go and get you some regular ol beans from Starbucks or you can swing over to Urban Beans and grab a cup full of something local and special just for you! I love the feel of this little place. Totally fits the name. Urban and trendy kind of coffee place within the heart of midtown.   The unique drinks you can get here are awesome also! The mocha almond smash and green tea smash are summer favorites for me. The large latte comes with four shots of espresso at a great price for under 5 bucks. They do this movie night one Monday of the month though I can't recal which right now.   All in alljust a great little coffee spot. Try it, you might like it!

Is this the best coffee place in the Phoenix metroplex area? No but there are a lot of things you can love about this place! The coffee and the rest of the drinks and treats are all Average at best. But do I have anything bad to say about this place? Absolutely not! I finally got to try this place that I heard so much about over Christmas vacation this last year 2016. The area is quiet but not bad and pretty close to the skyline. It's a privately owned place but the coolest thing is that it's one of the only coffee places around that is open 24 hours and it's also open during major holidays.  This is the reason why I went to go check it out in the first place because it was one of the only places open it on Christmas. I enjoyed being with family and friends but I do like to run around town and look for my adventures. This is what I hate about the holidays because everything seems to be closed. I totally understand that you're supposed to be sticking around the house with your family but my family goes to bed fairly early and I like to stay up pretty late especially around the holidays so this is a perfect place to go check things out with all your adventurous Friends and family members like to stay out late.  I wouldn't say it's the quiet type environment but it is subtle enough to do some homework if you need to get that done but also a good date place if you want to get to know somebody but I also like that you can bring small group in here and hang out and just enjoy yourself for as long as you want since it's open all day all night. Bottom line I highly recommend this place because of the hours alone and the service is superb as well. It's a very friendly environment with a neighborhood atmosphere and very artsy as well.
Lots of seats. Open 24/7. The only thing I'd ask for is more outlets near the center section tables away from the walls.
open 24 hours, yes you read that correctly! Need I say more!? Grab an iced coffee to go or hang out inside! They serve food, and booze too! Pretty much the only place you need to be!

Within walking distance of my office. 'Nuff said.   Okay well there is more. I've gotten accustomed to the whole "stay in the care in the drive thru" at places like starbucks, but got tired of doing the same old. Decided to check out Urban Beans...well a meeting brought me here...and was really happy with the experiences. The art is good, the place is a good size and not too overwhelming in sound or furniture, and the folks are nice. Even a nice outside porch for sitting, but that can get a little loud because of the street. I just like plain coffee, and its hot and strong.   I'm a big iced tea person, and they have great ice tea. The tea isn't too sweet, the large is actually large, and the value is definitely there. Plenty of parking too. I'll keep going.

My friend and I stopped after the Adele concert to get some strong coffee and hopefully a  tasty chocolate treat to share before our trip back to Tucson.   But alas, no chocolate in the case. We settled on the lemon lavender cake (which I'm sure was yummy) and ordered a couple of lattes, but happened to ask the guy behind the counter if by some chance they might have anything chocolate in the back. He disappeared for a few minutes, and a lovely woman came out and said she'd heard we wanted some chocolate and said, "We take our chocolate very seriously here." -- then told us she was going to make us a special treat and asked whether we preferred light or dark chocolate (definitely dark). Wow. Impressive.  About 15 minutes later, she came out with a beautiful tart made with shortbread crust and a dark chocolate ganache filling, topped with pecans and caramel sauce. Gorgeous presentation, and the taste was beyond heaven -- literally the best dessert I've ever had. The still-warm ganache was deep, dark, soul-satisfying CHOCOLATE. Oh Lordy, we were in hog heaven. We polished that baby off, finished our lattes, and made a speedy and contented trip back to Tucson.   Thanks to the warm and thoughtful folks who work there--you're there best (and your baker is amazing)! I'll be back!

Great coffee and awesome pastries. The strawberry scone is insanely delicious. Owners are always friendly and go out of their way to remember names and faces.   The homemade cream soda is also a great choice.

I've been here four or five times and never been too impressed. The atmosphere, art installations and eclectic seating gave me high hopes. The location is also unbeatable, walking distance from my place. But the service has always been sub-par, like it's a bother to take my order and converse with me.  Everyone here, including most of the clientele, seem way too cool for school.  The iced tea, my usual, is good; the iced coffee is great-tons of flavor and plenty of body. Espresso drinks are pretty standard for your indie coffee shop. I've asked for their vegan pastry (which changes daily) three times only to be told that they ran out for the day. I know that this happens, and I love that they freshly bake their goodies everyday and have a rotating menu, but I would also like to try the vegan scone sometime please.  Today, I ordered a strawberry-raspberry-cranberry smoothie ($5 for a small!) and confirmed with the boy behind the counter that the smoothies are vegan/non-dairy. He said yes then informed me that they use Naked juices for the base then just add fruit and ice. (Naked juice! So that's where the $5 price tag comes from!) Three minutes later, I was handed a delicious looking smoothie topped with...whipped cream...?  Really?!
Tried this place for the first time today- really great. Fun and funky vibe that reminds me of local coffee places back in Colorado where I'm from.

Stumbled upon this place on Thanksgiving while trying to find a coffee shop that was open. They're open 24/7 - 365 which is awesome if you ask me! The staff was great and the Americano was well done, the atmosphere is sorta hipster coffee shop but nice and comfortable. They have outdoor seating which is always a plus too. Overall, a great experience and definitely a go to for those late night coffee needs!

I've never felt so valued as a customer as I do when I'm at Urban Beans. Seriously. I didn't think it was possible to feel so appreciated just for regularly stopping in. The people here are great. Although the staff is enough to make this place exceptional, UB is a good choice for many reasons: it's open 24/7, the pastries are delicious(the mocha scone will change your life), the menu is completely vegetarian/vegan, and everything is well-priced. Opt for here instead of the Starbucks next door, and you'll be making the right decision.

Wow.  A very political place.  Very Left side politics.  There was some crazy political party going on when I went to see this local coffee house.   If you are far left and want to see a political Rally this is the place to be.  If you are at the least bit Independent or Moderate I would seek a coffee elsewhere.
Great place to hang out and enjoy made from scratch baked goods and burritos. Excellent and friendly service and a great atmosphere.  Go!

I've been coming here for about two years and I still love it. I do an iced, decaf latte (yea, I know it sounds stupid) and their decaf espresso is perfect. Also, they put in the right number of shots on the big drinks to keep from diluting the espresso.   Yesterday, I had the Delux breakfast sandwich. It's such a good little sandwich with a nice aioli and some arugula. It's definitely worth trying if you have been sticking to the basic sandwich.

I really appreciate an all-night cafe in Phoenix, but the menu reads better than it tastes. We tried the pumpkin curry bowl and kale quinoa salad. Everything seemed prepackaged and preserved, very little freshness. The "legendary" hummus was just OK. And we were charged for an additional hummus platter we didn't order.  Urban Beans was nice enough to remove the charge, plus a little extra. when we called the next day. Classy.

This is my second time here but my first review the first time I came I got the bean burrito which was super super spectacular and an iced chai! This time I got an iced chai and a banana nut muffin, and I must say their iced chai is probably the best I've ever had (as you can see I keep coming back) lol And the banana nut muffin is to die for! The staff is nice there was two girls when I came in one of the girls was getting yelled at by another customer (not too sure why because she's really sweet and it didn't seem like she did anything wrong) and I was the customer after him and she dusted the situation off like It didn't even happen. I definitely commend her for that!! Only reason why I give this place for out of five stars is because the first time I came in I wouldn't say the staff was rude but they just really weren't that attentive.
I've been here 2x wasn't impressed the first time figured give them a second try. There latte doesn't impress me I'd rather goto the Starbucks adjacent to this spot

I USED to brag about Urban Beans to everyone I know. I used to hang out there at least 3 times a week. THEN something horrifying happened, my once favorite coffee place changed! & it morphed into something no longer identifiable. I took my mother to Urban Beans, upon walking in the door the entire restaurant was permeated by extreme body odor. Not only was the smell gagging, but all but 1 of the tables was dirty. The only 1 without dirty dishes was sticky. Still, we attempted to order coffee however, a large mocha & a small black coffee was apparently a brain teaser for the barista. Our simple order was messed up twice. We tried again, by ordering bread pudding French toast. Alas, this was again a big mistake. Not only was our food served cold, it came with no utensils. I was so embarrassed I spent the entire afternoon apologizing to my mom. I have never been back nor will I ever go back. PSA-There is a Tip Jar located at the register but beware, our very astute & creative barista automatically added a 15% gratuity to our bill. AND never request a glass of water or you will be pointed to an empty pitcher without a glass to be found within the vicinity of this zip code. Frightful indeed.

Always my favorite coffee shop.  Too bad the baristas remember my fiancé but not me, even though we always come in together. Pfft.  But that's okay. I can take solace in their georgia peach tea and gluten-free/vegan english muffin. Toasted with just the right preserves, it makes my belly happy. I cheated on my diet but that's okay. Just don't tell my doctor.  I have always been a fan of their food. I did knock this down to 4 stars because they seem to have dumped a lot of the vegan/gluten-free options they used to have. Super sad face.  Also, there was a very loud man in there asking for money, yesterday. But he quickly left. Loud conversation is very distracting. It is not the quietest coffee shop if there are many people, but it is still nice!

Came here for the first time last week. We were welcomed by a staff member who asked if we had ever been here before--since we hadn't she explained the menu and everything about the cafe. The food, coffee and service was great!

Ummmm! As a vegetarian, I'm embarrassed I hadn't been here yet and it's a mile from my house!!! I've seen it but figured it was just pastries and didn't have a full menu. I can be an espresso snob, and this was amazing! I stayed and studied for a few hours. I also got the bean, potato, and cashew cheese burrito. It was very good but carb heavy- next time I'll see if they can add greens and tofu. Overall, I'm so sad I hadn't come here before. I will definitely be back- they have alcohol too! The only thing that bothered me was that they didn't have a matcha soy latte, or at least the guy couldn't tell me exactly what was in their version (he said it had dairy). Maybe that's a really fancy drink, and I just wasn't aware.

I just went here for morning coffee for the first time. I ordered a hazelnut latte. The service was very nice and all was well, until I took my first sip later in the car. Ewwww. The coffee is completely burnt. This made my usually slightly sweet latte into a nasty bitter mess of disappointment. $4 later I have to throw this away and buy a new one somewhere else. It's completely undrinkable.

With so many amazing coffee shops nearby, you would think Urban Beans would be trying hard to compete. We stopped in for coffee after leaving Taco Guild, and the coffee was not good at all. We ended up dumping our cups and driving to another cafe. Also, I'm not vegan, and it was only after I ordered that I realized this is a vegan place. I prefer cream with my coffee, so that was another strike for me.

One of the best Americanos in the greater Phoenix area and served in a huge ceramic mug. Let me repeat that: a HUGE mug, and I ordered a small.  After securing a two person table (the tabletop had cool artwork on it) and sitting in a super comfortable chair, I looked into the depths of my Americano and decided that I'd like something from the pastry cabinet to complement the espresso or I'd be flying higher than a kite, which ended up being a blueberry muffin with a strong fresh blueberry flavor. I would have had a scone too but then dinner would never happen. By the way, the lunch menu here looked  awesome, but it was close to 3 p.m. and for me, that means afternoon coffee.  The inside space isn't huge, but the outside patio space is. In fact, just outside my window a man sat eating an awesome looking salad.   I absolutely loved the wall art and the funky tables, but the coffee and the food will have me coming back here every time I'm in the area. Urban Beans, you have my loyalty.
Super chill vibe. Ordered the latte and it was delicious and served very artistically. Will visit again soon!

Open 24hrs during the week jackfruit sandwiches homemade bbq sauce convenient location.  What's not to like about UB? I am impressed, and aside from finding a strand of hair in my food, they sandwiches is yummies. Love the bread. I'm not sure if it's considered ciabatta but it's very similar. I wish I liked the baked sweets as much, but none of them have tasted good to me.

Came in to try the iced coffee. Very good cold brew. Something was cooking on the flat top that smelled so good, I will be back for lunch. Saw some reviews of paying a high price for the iced coffee, but they must have purchased the 32 ounces because my 16 oz was just about $3, less than the franchise across the street. Glad to know how close this place is to work. Too bad we didn't have more local coffee houses out in north Peoria like this. Great place. Hats off to the owners

Stopped in for a coffee and lunch to go.  Had the jackfruit torte and it was delicious.  I love the dipping sauce that it came with,.. I would dip everything in that if I could buy it by the bottle , haha... :) The coffee was great too!

LOVING that we have a cool, comfortable place to work with a patio that has atmosphere.  I wasn't loving the food, but they had a good selection of drinks, teas and smoothies.  The atmosphere is great for working and there are plenty of outlets.  Oh, and the bathroom is very nice - a plus in my book.   Definitely going to be one of my main places to hang out with my computer.
First time there. I bought a bag of toffee pecan at the register I started to nibble on it when I got home I actually ate the whole bag its very very evil in a good way YUM yummmm
Tried this place for the first time with some friends in a Friday evening and really enjoyed it.  Friendly staff,  nice feel,  and the chai tea latte was yummy.

Popped in here because a friend and I were looking for some place to hang out and chat after dinner, and I'm so glad I found it! It's like it's specifically designed to make you want to get comfortable and chill for a while. It's not a large space, but we found a booth and enjoyed our drinks and a shared square of cheesecake with lemon custard. I had a raspberry mocha, which was nicely bittersweet, and she finished her large coffee in record time. The coffee really helped cut the richness and sweetness of the cheesecake, which was a bit much for my taste.   The girl working the counter was super amiable, and offered suggestions when we were staring at the menu board in a stupor.  The thing I think could improve my visit are the bathrooms, which weren't messy, but need some TLC.

Mmm their hazelnut latte (iced) is delish. I've tried their chai latte (hot) and I'm not sure if I'm a big fan of it. The first time I came here it was made to perfection, but the other two times it tasted so bland (like drinking warm milk).   Service is always good and they're always willing to take their time to answer any questions that you may have for them.

The barista was incapable of making a mocha or a hot chocolate. I took it back twice and was still bitter and horrible. My boyfriend's caramel macchiato was mixed poorly: all the caramel on the bottom. They were also out of lids...

Well, I can't say enough about how creative they are here. Featured art Work-friendly atmosphere Talented pastry chef Healthy menu added recently  Still there despite the recent emergence of a Starbucks right next door.  They have been around serving coffee a long  while and even added a bar and 24hour service.  The only downside is their food menu may be out of price range for some older, loyal patrons who want to be more supportive.

Oh, Urban Beans, after 15 visits on various days of the week and at all sorts of times of day, how have I not yet reviewed your awesomeness?  The truth is, I don't really care about your iced tea, which IS tasty, and I don't really care about your Caprese sandwich (which I have devoured numerous times).  What I REALLY, really love...  is your muffins.  You are magic with the muffins.  I have had every flavor you sell, I think, and each one has been more delicious than the last, with my favorite being the raspberry mango.  I always tell myself I will save some for later.    Turns out later is about 15 seconds after "before."  Thank you for allowing me to have my dogs (both big and small) on your patio.  Thank you for understanding that I prefer four-legged children to two.  Thank you for having doable business hours, great prices, and EVEN for having irresistible homemade pasta in your establishment for me to take home and cook later.  I just love you, Urban Beans!

I really want to support local, but when owners or managers are setting otherwise sweet employees up for failure it makes it hard. When someone has to spend 10 bucks on a drink it needs to be consistent. Friendly counter people with little to no training not even a recipe, or the right ingredients.  You never know what your drink will taste like even when you order the same thing, depending on who is working that day. And to not stock the shop with everything you need and still charge the same outrageous price makes no sense. I'm done trying. No offense to the working staff, but they are being failed.

Urban Beans has very quickly become my fave coffee shop in Phoenix. It's locally owned, unique, good food and coffee, great service, free WiFi, and awesome hours. All of these bode well for a full-time employee + grad student. On weeks when I have an exam, you can find me in here nearly every night.    They have a Sunday brunch, and always some tasty snacks (quiche, muffins, scones, cookies, etc.) and even breakfast items. Vegan options are available also.   There's a wine bar also!   I love the quirky furniture and artwork (which is for sale, by the way). I love giving my patronage to locally-owned businesses, and this is a really good one.

So this is my first time coming to Urban Beans with my mother and I had high hopes for it but apparently too high. My mother and I both ordered pumpkin pecan scones and I ordered a iced latte. The pumpkin pecan scones texture was good but it didn't taste anything like pumpkin and only really tasted like a flavorless scone with pecans in it. So usually I get iced lattes at least once or twice a week at different coffee shops that I normally go too and I expected this iced latte to taste as good or even better than my other ones but I was extremely disappointed with this one especially. First of all, the lady who made the drinks was extremely sloppy with making them and she made my drink spill all over the counter and it was dripping on the side of my cup and I had to clean it up myself. She didn't even put a lid or straw in it for me I had to do it myself too. The taste in the latte was horrible too. The coffee shop was so sloppy and we ordered for here but they put our scones in a to-go bag and the cashier even forgot to bring us up. Overall I am disappointed with this cafe and most likely would not come back here or even recommended it to anyone.

One of the things I truly love about Phoenix is their coffee culture and when it's supporting small, local businesses I support them 100%  Urban Beans is a coffee shop that not only serves coffee, but has a wine bar and pastries. There's ample amounts of space to sit inside and a patio facing 7th street that's great for lounging.  Ordered a Chai Latte and tried Anthony L.'s Latte- the pours are generous! Don't let the lack of latte art fool you, their coffee is bold and true. I enjoyed my Chai, it wasn't watered down like how it is at Lux and had a good amount of spice that wasn't too light nor spicy- sorry extra spicy Chai lovers. It tasted like Christmas and felt like a hug from the inside out.  Definitely a great spot!

It's so sad to me that people line up at Starbucks across the street when there's Urban Beans, a great LOCAL coffee shop at the corner of 7th St & Osborn in downtown Phoenix. I've enjoyed everything from their fresh, handmade scones, biscotti, coffee cake and quiche to yummy chai and espresso drinks. I've been coming here for 3+ years and will always return for the warm ambiance and super friendly service. Oh and they have free wi-fi, a cute wine bar, great happy hour and lunch/dinner savory options too. Enjoy!

My favorite coffee house ever!  It is so rare that there is a coffeehouse that isn't musty, pretentious, dark, metal-toned, or all of the above!  There was plenty of parking, and I came out of Urban Beans happier than going in.  I walked into a nice open, bright, inviting environment.  One table had a meeting going on; another had web browsing; and another had one person moleskine writing.  I walked in, and the two baristas were so non-pressure, friendly, and nice.  They recommended their version of the frappe, and it was so worth the $5.  Do NOT skip the whipped cream.  That is the best part.  I rarely order dairy drinks or whipped cream, but this whipped cream was so fresh and light and almondy.  So good!  I loved sitting down and seeing the whites and wood-tones and little oil candles and fresh flowers at each table.  I am not sure how busy this place is in the morning or early afternoon or weekends, but my experience was A-plus!  I want to move next door to Urban Beans!

Great neighborhood stopover and stress relief.  Uncomplicated but complex.  I enjoy sitting outside, taking in an eclectic array of things artfully strewn about.  My favorite bites are desserts. Looking forward to other fare beyond breakfast crafted to pleaseand, and takes time. Yum! Assistance with selection and pairing have been great with each visit. Thanks!

Great coffee, but the woman making the coffee was extremely rude (woman with short dark hair). Won't come back...I think if you hate your job that much and act like that to people you're in the wrong industry.
I liked this place, it had a cute little vibe. Open 24 hours!!! Coffee was great & their french toast was also TO DIE FOR.

Regarding @urbanbeans :  Urban:   1.  pertaining to, of, or designating a city or town 2.  living in a city 3.  characteristic of or accustomed to cities; citified  Bean:  1.  the edible nutritious seed of various plants of the legume family 2.  a plant producing such seeds 3.  the pod of such a plant, especially when eaten as a vegetable 4. any of various other beanlike seeds or plants, as the coffee bean  Urban Bean:  1.  a business located in the city of Phoenix serving refreshments produced by various methods from the seed or "bean" of the commercially cultivated  tropical tree of the genus Coffea, of the madder family, especially C. arabica  and C. canephora  2.  a local establishment in an urban setting offering a relaxing atmosphere and tasty beverages as well as free wifi and an assortment of pastries  *thanks to @dailydefinition

An industrial-chic bungalow built just inside of the Coronado Historic District that showcases a loved downtown in an urban setting. The art and people are always beautiful.  Cappuccino, along with Caffe Latte are my two most common espresso drinks. This one today gets four shots of espresso. The cup is huge. The drink is excellent.

So happy they finally went all vegan !!! I just wish they offered items without soy / tofu (yes-I understand how common this is). Good chill atmosphere on patio yummy lemonades pictured is hibiscus lavender lemonade
why go to Starbucks when the Bean is right here on the same corner???  Sweet people and good fresh food and coffee. My fav local brew.

First time here, and I'm pleasantly surprised. Amazing customer service that's able to guide the causal coffee drinker. They're not afraid to ask you questions to ensure your drink is perfect. The atmosphere is cozy with a bit of hipster sprinkled throughout. Business suits, don't let the word hipster scare you, it's very fitting for that away-from-the-office meeting. More comfortable seating condusive to accomplishing your to-do list would have earned a fifth star.

My friend had been insisting we go to Cinnabon but I suggested this place. She beat me there, was halfway through a cinnamon oat scone, rice krispy treat and a coffee, and was so pleased with everything that she proclaimed all meetings will henceforth be at local coffee shops. That's a big deal for her to abandon Cinnabon!  So - Urban Beans is a cute little coffee shop. Ample seating inside, cute art on the walls that's for sale, and a really nice little patio outside.   I had a soy white mocha and a java chip scone, and it was only $7.50  That would run $10 at the big green mermaid!  Both were really really good.   They aren't doing made-to-order food anymore, which is what I think most bad reviews are about. The pastries are all freshly baked though.  Only thing that could be better is put some music on or something. It was deathly quiet and I felt like everyone else was listening to our conversation. We moved outside because of that.

I love this place!! UB is everything a coffeehouse should be. Friendly staff, great coffee, and from what I saw, yummy eats. This is a great place to just sit and have a drink, or come to get some work done while you sip/nosh on something delicious. The atmosphere is bright and there are beautiful, artsy mandalas currently on the walls. There's an outdoor patio and a rack to lock up your bike. I can't think of anything this place is missing, hence the five stars...  Overall, if you want a great cup of coffee and a very pleasant caffeine experience, head to UB.
The best coffee and food.  Try the Raspberry Mocha  Smash with Raspberry Drizzle and whip cream, anazing!

The first time I came here was for lunch. Not knowing it was a vegan place, I still ordered.  It was some type of empanada with veggies and pesto inside. I think it could have been good,  but the bottom of it was hard as a rock. Thank goodness it came with a sauce, that made a world of difference. Also, not having been here before I sat down thinking that our food would be brought to our table. Well 20 min later, with an almost empty restaurant, we had to go check on our food.   I did not post a review that time and decided I'd go back and try their coffee since I consider myself quite the coffee snob. I always judge a place by their ability to make a latte, and although I have had better lattes, I still am giving this place 3 stars. Which is generous considering how I really feel. But young lady behind the counter was chipper and talkative for it being so early in the morning, so three stars they get. Also, I understand that they are open 24 hrs. So if I ever find myself roaming around in the middle of the night needing espresso (or a beer) I'll stop by again.

I'm going to up my review for Urban Beans to five stars. The music generally seems to have improved, but more importantly, the weekend brunch offerings are awesome. In addition to a la carte items, UB offers a great multi-course breakfast, with your choice of side, main dish (including custom omelet), coffee and adult beverage (choice of mimosa or bloody mary). I don't remember the exact price but it's around $15 and worth every penny. And, if I'm going to have to be a coffee shop working on Sunday, it's awesome to be able to get a real breakfast and not just a pastry. Highly recommended :)

This week the Jolly Diners went to Urban Beans on 7th St., Phx. It's an intriguing place because it's one of the few that is open 24/7, and that serve vegan food. The place is small and according to the staff has been there for 7 years, so that must be doing things right. I ordered a #1 breakfast burrito with tofu scramble added to the burrito. Mom ordered over-easy fried egg with roasted potatoes. My sister had a veggie wrap.The menu really doesn't have appetizers, but to start with we had an Alise Caprisce with tofu and tomato on bread, with balsamic vinegar. There was way too much balsamic vinegar. They didn't have any Diet Coke or Pepsi so it was water or coffee or some kind of a fruit drink. Even with some downsides, when the food came it was actually quite delicious; the chef having done a stellar job of preparing burritos and veggie wraps. Overall the Jolly Diners rated Urban Beans a 3 out of 5. This is a place for students to have a quick meal and coffee at a reasonable price.

Iced dirty chia with cinnamon, a bean, egg, chz, potato, mano-poblano burrito, a mano-poblano with bacon muffin, pear scone , carrot cake, mint mojito (kale, apple, mint, ?). A vegan/vegetarian joint that is open 24/7. Can't beat that with a stick!
The breakfast burrito with egg is excellent, so is the pumpkin curry! Friendly staff. Food takes a little while to make so it's best to call it in if you're in a hurry.

I'd say I'm a regular at this place. I'm here at least twice a week, but tonight was absolutely horrid. I waited over 45 for my drink and a berry scone which was burnt. The wifi was out and when I asked about my order I was given attitude instead of an apology. I'm sort of disappointed.

What I Loved: -dog friendly patio -good brew of coffee and Americano  -free coffee refills when you check in (a bug flew in my Americano while I was chilling' in the patio before I could finish it so they were kind enough to make me a new one for free with my yelp check-in SO AWESOME) -Super friendly staff -Yummy New Yorker Quiche -Delish Scramble plate   It's my new go to coffee spot which I can bring my fur baby to and grab a light snack as well!

It's in a good location and works well enough as a cafe. They share their location with a wine bar that starts serving in the afternoon. It would make a pretty good date location. Depending on who you get at the counter service can be either stellar or almost laughable.
Mad respect for a 24 hour coffee shop. Only suggestion is for some background tunes!!

Coffee here is pretty legit. School place to hang out with friends drink coffee and also they serve a lot more than just coffee. They also serve wine and other drinks as well. It's pretty cool set up. I would totally recommend this coffee shop Over Starbucks any day!!!!

To my knowledge, there is only one other 24-hour coffee house in the greater Phoenix area  (The Grand near ASU downtown), and in general only a handful of other coffee shops open past 8PM. So that right there gives them stars on stars.  As a student usually working after hours, I usually go with UB over the grand because  1. 24-hour breakfast burritos  2. more light = less drowzy  3. It doesn't turn into a poppin bar after 7:00 (though sometimes this is the main reason I would choose the Grand instead).     UB has an AMAZING vegan pastry/food/ice cream selection as well as a fun cocktail menu. The drinks are alright, but that is where the 4 stars/5 comes in for me. Example: I love a good date shake and I've ordered theirs three times with different results each time... but unfortunately all sub-par. Their iced teas are excellent however, and no complaints about any of the espresso drinks I've ever ordered, though sadly nothing to write home about.   The other reason I gave 4/5 stars concerns the staff. There's some fantastic people working here, but that hasn't been my experience across the board. Excellent customer service appears (to me) to be based more on person-to-person character than on company training. Most of the time I have no qualms, but on occasion there is an aloof or indifferent attitude on the other side of the counter. But, to their credit, if I was working at 2AM I probably wouldn't be all that excited either.   The primary UB assets that keep me coming back are location (proximity to Buffalo Exchange is a BIG plus ;) ), open 24hrs/7 days a week, a chill atmosphere (live music sometimes), the huge 24-hr vegan-friendly menu, and consistent wifi. Also, maybe a dumb thing to add, but I work in a coffee shop that doesn't have an in-house bathroom, and UB has two... so if you're on a study marathon, no fear- you're not away from your laptop for long.  Would definitely recommend giving them a try!

Been here way more than a few times, I don't drink coffee so I usually get a smoothie or cream soda as a drink. Their food is also perfectly proportioned and delicious. I love the salmon melt and the turkey sandwich is also very good; they put any cheese on it as long as you ask!

I'm a big fan of Americano's and Urban Beans makes a great one! The barista's were very friendly, the pastries all looked delicious and one of them definitely was. They also serve beer and wine later in the day which makes me want to go back later. Nicely decorated with art, the weather this morning was beautiful so we sat out doors on the patio. One draw back today was that one of the bathrooms was out of order and the other needed a small amount of cleaning. All in all I was a great experience and I'd definitely recommend it.

I really wanted to like this place, their menu is awesome packed with variety and they can make ANYTHING on their menu vegan. They have free wifi, decent prices, exceptionally spacious seating (inside and out), and best of all, they're open 24/7.   Unfortunately, I am unsure if I had caught them on a bad night or not but my experience here was not up to my standards, even with all the great perks. I ordered multiple items and they were out of the non baked items I wanted. I then jumped to order baked goods and their oven was down. So then, my sister and I settled on some drinks.My sister and I wanted a lattes, and seeing a picture of a latte on the counter, we pointed. The gal responded with "it won't look like that by the way" talking about the free poured milk, way to kill the vibe lol. I got a raspberry Italian soda taking the recommendation from the barista,  and my sister ended with an iced chai tea latte. The drinks weren't bad, nor were they superb, so I wouldn't go out of my way getting them. We really wanted something to munch on so she recommended the hummus plate with pita and our total came out to be about $15. Also, as we were waiting on our order, we continuously heard them telling other customers that they were out of ingredients.   The hummus plate came out with really chunky and really cold hummus and stale room temperature pita bread that wasn't warmed all the way, on a bed of spinach.   I wish the perks of this place could bypass all the negatives for me, but I really think one visit it good enough for me.
I thought our drinks were good, but the atmosphere was a bit cold. I would drive another two miles to get coffee elsewhere.

Really was looking forward to trying a new coffee shop close to home, however left feeling disappointed with my location of choice! The baristas were lacking in knowledge of menu and manners and seemed disinterested in myself and other customers' needs. The dog-friendly patio was the best thing about the entire place! Dismal service and bland java. Would not recommend over other local coffee shops

This morning I was craving some tea so I decided to stop in here and treat myself, first timer. I had the peppermint hot tea and I noticed on their menu they had vegan options. I asked the gentlemen in the front and he said they are completely a vegetarian restaurant with a lot of vegan options. He also informed me of their vegan lunch options. I came back and tried the smoked tofu sandwich with nut cheese and my gosh, it was SO delicious!!! I give this restaurant 5 stars, I almost wasn't even going to stop in but I am so glad that I did!

Guys! If you havent tried their MaTcha FraPpuccino please do because they Have the best of all!! Plenty of Vegan options and amazing pastry. Oh and my favorite hot dish is the Curry stew if you are in to spicy food I highly recommend it. Their burrito are also legit the jackfruit one with the tofu scramble is a winner. Enjoy! Super cute patio and ambiance as well perfect to chill when you are not in the rush :)

I just bought a chai tea latte.  The description said "spices stretched five ways."  I paid $5 for a small chai latte (including 18% tip and almond milk sub).  I watched the barista steam the milk and add a couple pumps of a syrup.  That's it.  Why the unnecessary fancy description of "spices stretched 5 ways"? Why charge people $5 for 8 ounces of hot milk and 2 pumps of syrup??  This is the kind of thing that infuriates people about coffee shops.

Service was slow. Ordered a nonfat chai latte with shot of espresso, not too complicated. The chai was bitter due to the herbs not being strained out which also made it gritty- a very unpleasant texture in a drink. The only pluses about this place is the decor & patio. Didn't try any food but it looked good.

I like the overall ambience of this coffee shop. It has a sense of serious coffee and work feel to it. Lots of laptops and discussions going on. I ordered a large vanilla latte with whole milk. No problem. It was served in a huge ceramic cup. Awesome. And it tasted great! Because I had heard (read on yelp) that the food here was excellent, we decided to order a scone. At three o'clock in the afternoon, the choices were slim and we had to settle for a blueberry muffin. This was very moist and the blueberries had great flavor. You can also buy a beer or a glass of wine here so everyone who comes here should be able to get what he/she wants. The art on the walls is a great experience enhancer.

my wackass chinchilla head with one working ear due to a sickness  was craving some soup. I said to the hubby hey let's get some soup so I can not feel like I'm dying anymore and get some relief for my shitty cold or whatever shit I have (the docs won't tell me, it's a scheme to kill us all or force us upon $100 copays) so hubby finds this fine establishment. they had pumpkin curry soup. sick. can't wait. so we get in there and the guy is nice, great customer service there. so then I'm paying and I realize it's $20 for two soups...,,,,(=??)?  (sorry the face is a shortcut in my phone)  my crumby chimp ass could have went to the store and gotten a $1 can of Amy's soup which would have filled me up more and been more edible than this skunk  diarrhea. the taste wasn't that BAD but for $20 I expected a bowl bigger than what was served (probably about the size of a newborn mouse foot) I expected this shit to be Jesus's piss for $20. nope. could've found some free sewage instead. so yeah completely overpriced and just pretty ridiculous so if you're into that check this place out. damn vegans and their potato sack shoes. im back to eating meat from now on. i am eating a rib as I type this.

I love this place: chill atmosphere, friendly service, and delicious caffeinated and/or alcoholic beverages. Not only is it open 24/7, the drink menu is full of creative flavors and delicious coffee. I fell in love with the Joyous Almond which is a mix of their toddy iced coffee, mocha, coconuts, and almonds - bits of coconuts and almonds come in your drink, and a regular is about the size of a Venti at Starbucks, with much more taste and not at all the over priced tag to it.  The staff is super friendly and knowledgeable, (at least the ones that come between 9-12). They'll give you tastes of the beers and recommendations, and hook you up if they're out of something with the coffee drinks. There's lots of seating, and this sounds so small, but the fact that all their chairs have comfy cushions on the backs, is amazing. When you sit for long periods of time working, this makes a huge difference for back problems. As for the clientele, I've seen a mixture of students, healthcare workers, gay guys, and old timers. Basically anyone and everyone could walk through the door, and that's pretty awesome.

This is the best place ever. The customer service is amazing. The staff treats everyone who walks through the doors with such kindness. The 24/7 food is amazing. The pumpkin and panang curry is so delicious, so are the breakfast burritos and the pastries. I've spent so many hours studying here and it actually makes cramming for exams less miserable.... which says a lot :) Best cafe in phx hands down!! I tell everyone I know about this place.
Didn't stay long as the environment was not very inviting and there was not much of a food selection.

I stopped in to Urban Beans on my way to work to treat myself to a local establishment's cup of joe (versus stopping at the brand new Starbucks a block away) and I'm glad I did. I ordered up a nonfat vanilla latte, iced and the gal that made it made it perfectly! The flavor is all there and the espresso--delish! I also ordered the farm egg sandwich. While it was good, I probably wouldn't order it again. The egg is mixed with peppers and spices to give it a kick but it wasn't my cup of tea. The sandwich was supposed to come with an English muffin but I actually think I was given a bagel. When you're trying to watch your carb intake, it was just too much bread.  This all said, I rate this joint 4 stars. coffee is 5 but the sandwich portion knocked it down one. I'll stop back in again for some coffee and after 10 visit, their loyalty program will give me 10% off!

Me: What's the wifi password? Him: 'thankyou'" all lowercase. Me: Thank you Him: that's right Me: No, I mean thanks Him: No, thank you Me: Right, I'm just to say thank YOU for giving me the password Him: Saying it to me won't help though, you'll have to type it into your laptop Me: You're funny Him: thank you Me: ...is the password. Got it.  Only at Urban Beans do you get a complementary Abbott and Costello routine with your coffee. One of my fav new spots. Love it.

We went here because my college-age kids said it was one of the best coffee shops in Phoenix. Key word: WAS. As we started to order, the order-taker must have been new because she had to consult the barista on every item she entered/ordered. The shop was missing items from cups to syrups (no white chocolate mocha) and hardly had any assortments of food. To top it off, the bathrooms were completely disgusting--not clean and no hot water for hand washing--ewww.  This shop has the potential for being outstanding because the decor is nice & customers like to support small business coffee shops instead of major chains. This shop needs to hire the right people and pay them to make a difference. Being located right next to a Starbucks, this shop should not give customers a reason not to come back. Remember, for every 1 person who complains, statistically there are 26 who go away and never come back.

My favorite late night, study spot! I can't even count how many times I've been here. With friendly staff and yummy café drinks, as well as some alcoholic beverages and yummy treats, this place is definitely a go-to. Love having some delicious vegan options, the jack fruit bake is my number 1!
Last two times I have been here it is very dirty. Dead flowers on the counter, dirty plates, dirty floor. Hey, the coffee is good but the place just isn't clean. Seems to stay busy though.

I was never a big fan of Hazelnut, but my friend told its good, try it.. so what did I do? I got the hazelnut latte. Ahhhhh mayyyy singggggg. :)) not only that, the chai latte is superb, and the caramel latte. Basically I Can go on and on. Hehe   Great atmosphere,  wonderful friendly staff and suoer clean. I came here one time to get away and read. Haha yes. It was perfect.

I finally detoured myself down 7th St yesterday morning and stopped here.  Got a great iced soy latte and a mango scone.  Yum.  Stopped there again today and got a hot soy latte and a cranberry walnut scone with lime glaze...seriously yum.  Cute place, good art, friendly staff, easy parking, great soy lattes, great scones = my new favorite coffee shop.  And free wi-fi and a lovely patio!
Came here for a double shot of espresso.   Very clean taste and liked the smoothness of the espresso.    Can't go wrong and it's close by the office!

Swung by this place and the service was excellent.  Very friendly guys behind the counter and in the back-of-the-house.  The only food I tried was their balsamic pear flatbread, which was a nice combination of salty and sweet.  They had a variety of housemade baked goods and their coffee/wine selection seems to be a major focus. Casual and comfy place(with outside seating) to study or go meet up with a friend for coffee/small bite.

The BEST coffee place I've ever been to. The staff is always friendly and often hilarious. The drinks are delicious and everything is reasonably priced. I love that they sell local art and the atmosphere is perfect. They even have chess if you need something to do besides the internet. My fiancé and I had our first date here and if we hadn't moved to Gold Canyon, we would still be visiting constantly.

Pretty diverse menu, with good vegan and gluten-free options.  Decent service. Very laid-back vibe; it's a good place to spend an hour or two, but don't expect to quickly run in and out with your morning coffee.

Nowhere else in the PHX metropolitan area can you satisfy your midnight and beyond vegan cravings. Sandwiches and desserts, 24/7, baby!  I have not yet strayed from my usual Jackfruit Torta entree, so I don't know what their other vegan options are like, but the Jackfruit is bomb! It's flavorful and filling. I always get my order with a side of plain chips.    Don't forget to ask about the vegan desserts. Some are labeled, but not always.  And I've learned that the employees are not all educated on what is and isn't vegan, but one of the co-owners informed me that their apple pies are always vegan. I'll have to try the apple pie a la mode next time!  I have tried their brownie a la mode and their homemade toffee. Yum!   The parking lot is small and fills quickly. Prices are reasonable.  The patio is small but charming.  Did I mention that they're open 24/7??!  If they sold vegan pancakes, they'd be the hipster Denny's/IHOP.

So I have been coming into this coffee shop for a few months.. enjoyed the atmosphere and everyone is nice.  Went in today ordered my coffee and I enjoy just a touch of cream.. I was told the place went all Vegan.  Really,  Almond milk with my coffee.. not sure if they changed their beams also but this was the WORST cup of coffee I have had since I stopped buying coffee at Starbucks..  Sad as I really enjoyed the place butI will NEVER. One back  and will also make sure my friends are updated with the new Vegan change.

This is probably one of my favorite coffee shops to visit. The staff is extremely friendly and helpful especially Axil!!  The vegan options that are also offered are pretty ama zing. This is also a great place to get some study time in. And did I mention they are open 24x7...whaaatttttt!!!!

A new fave place to set up shop, enjoy REALLY good coffee/espresso drinks, and get some work done with super-fast wifi!  The pastries have all been tasty and they have a good variety that changes along with the chef that is there each day.  And a special shout-out to the quiche that is ridiculously good.  The baristas are extremely personable and highly consistent.   When the weather cools a little, I look forward to getting some work done outside during the daytime under their covered patio.    Love it!

When I first moved here and started eating there the food was great when the manager would always come through and save the day. I've gotten a free meal twice because of how terrible the employees are. The management has changed and so has the menu but they have the same terrible employees with nasty attitudes. One time I called in an order for two burritos and she was very rude to me on the phone and wouldn't even give me my total or a n estimated time. When I arrived they ended up only making one and the same employee that took my phone order gave me a lot of attitude for their mistake and tried to blame everything on a rush that was no longer there. So the manager had to comp my meal because of how bad the cashier's attitude was. He even had to send her to the back. The food is always dry now and they raised the prices and changed the menu and it is not great at all I can't find anything that I enjoy to eat there any more so I have stopped going there. This is a full year of service in one review from me. Just shitty!

I have been to Urban Beans twice... once several years ago and again a couple months ago.... and they are very close to my house...so that says something. Their coffee just isn't very good. I believe they use expressions roasting (same as bikini beans) and the quality of their lattes just aren't fabulous. The last time I tried UB I had their 'spicy' dirty chai.... it just wasn't anything special. They get their 3rd star for their fabulous hours, but if I needed a coffee, and it wasn't the middle of the night, I would definitely go elsewhere.

I come to the establishment very often. It's a very laid back environment. Tonight, while enjoying my coffee, I witnessed a disturbance. A very angry and impatient customer came in with her family. The woman threw a fit after waiting 1 minute for a wine. The two staff members handled her nastiest in the best way. Even as she left with she yelled a homophobic comment and attempted to make scene in hopes to turn away customers. I hope she sees this and checks herself on her nasty and unacceptable behavior. And this is coming from a millennial.
Open 24 hours has goodies and decafe espresso. Works for me. Not fancy, but most important is the decafe the soy and almond milk.

Three stars for the food ONLY, customer service is awful!!  The girl at the counter had no idea what she was doing, the guy who appeared to be the leader there was cold and just there to take an order. I wish this place would've been more homey!! Ps their wifi is good. And 24/7. Even the girl I was with, who recommended the place, said "it used to be better." Booooo.

I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone. The people working here were very friendly but they were out of chai, quiche, and rosemary potatoes. They didn't even know about some of the stuff we tried to order. When I ordered the scrambled eggs and potatoes the barista came and said they were out of the potatoes but I could get anything else I wanted. I ordered an English muffin to go with my eggs. But only the English muffin came. They don't seem to have a clue as to what products and meals they offer and we will not be coming back. Oh ya. I ordered a strawberry shake, and was given chocolate. They are clueless.

These drink are amazing and the food looks amazing. Their customer service is great I would eat here any day! Strawberry Smash paired with a granola parfait and a Southern Tropic paired with scramble breakfast!

I've been here twice in the past month and will definitely be back. It's GeekVille. I mean, I was waiting for my date to show up and heard all about how Batman came to be or something like that. AND I heard people talking about Dungeons and Dragons. (Which was one of the causes for my divorce, but I don't hold it against other people, just my ex-husband.) There are a bunch of tables outside and two different rooms inside. One is set up like the computer lab in high school. Lots of laptops here! I love their iced tea. I get it every time. I know it sounds lame to include iced tea in a review, but I like it. I don't get the fancy schmancy flavored kind, either. I'm a purist, I guess. Staff is super friendly, too.  You need to ask them for the key to the bathroom, as it's outside, off the patio. They're really clean, too. On weekends, it's open 24 hours!!!!!!

I live in the area and I have been very interested in trying this out. They have also certificates on Restaurant.com but I did not purchase one. I definitely have my favorite coffee shops but I am always open to adding another one to the list. I took my daughter with me, along with some children's books to read on a rainy, AZ day. I got myself an sugar-free vanilla nonfat latte and my daughter a kids hot chocolate. I had to repeat my latte order like 3 times to the male employee and after I got it, waited for it to cool down and took a sip, I realized they never added the syrup. Pretty annoying given how many times I had to remind the guy what I ordered as he rung me up. The lady who made my daughter's hot chocolate added whipped cream and chocolate syrup and didn't make it too hot, which I really appreciated. My daughter still ended up spilling it on her white shirt. What I was thinking???? A 3 year old, hot chocolate and a white shirt?? Aahhh, the never-ending lessons of a new mom. Since I forgot to bring a snack for my daughter, I ordered a blueberry muffin for her and a chocolate chip cookie for me. Both were extremely good. The total for the drinks and food were just under $9 which I think is standard. As I looked in the display case, at the food, there was a pretty good variety. As other reviewers mentioned, the chairs are mismatched throughout. I found a table with a comfy chair (all of the other chairs were the standard, hard, wooden) since I planned to have my daughter in my lap as we read.   Overall, I would say I enoyed my time here (besides the drink mistake). I wish they had some arm chairs or couches or something but maybe they will in the future. There were alot of people here so U.B. seemed to be popular. I'm not sure if I would come back but maybe. I'm intrigued by the BYOB and the variety of events they have.

I come here a lot and about 50% of the time my order is screwed up! Today two out of my two drinks were wrong! Ugh, am I going to go back to fix them? No cause it took 30 mins. for the first order! So frustrated! I'm not demanding either. I asked for unsweetened on one drink and no whip and one less pump on the other! Hire more help please! Obviously they are too overwhelmed!

Just Love this place! My hair stylist is in the same parking lot, so when I was hungry last time it was the closest place and the most healthy. They offered this great market salad! A combination of 3 salads. One included  fresh sliced Strawbrries. They were so sweet and juicy. Yum!! They also had a variety of Quiches. I choose the mushroom/spinanch quiche. OMG to die for!! Then I also got the apple tart pie, which was excellent! I love deserts and you can tell they used fresh ingredients. I would recommend this place to most people especially if you like to remain on the healthy side when eating out, but also have a sweet tooth. Like myself. There is a great selection to choose from for the desserts. Oh and when you order in, the presentation of the food is picture perfect. I've ate there twice and I'll be back!

Urban Beans has a beautiful set up. There is amazing art inside all over the walls, with all different tables and chairs. The wine bar has a very nice set up also. The ouitside is a nice place to sit when the weather is nice and cool. It has a casual atmosphere. All of the people that work there are so nice! They seem to really like their job. The food there is delicious! Their drinks are good as well. I love stopping in to get a bite to eat and a drink. I like bringing my laptop to get some work there. The atmosphere is peaceful and quiet. I'd recommend Urban Beans to anyone who enjoys coffee and fresh food! Yum!
