Everything is bomb, everything vegan anyway. They have chicken menstruated stuff I won't eat. 24 hours of super cool too.

Love the atmosphere here.  There's a cool patio area with an herb garden (no, not that type of herb, you goofs), big comfy pillow-couches, and a few outlets.  Both times we've come here, we've been around near closing time, and both times the staff were super chill about it.  The first time, we were told that we were fine finishing our drinks outside while they cleaned up the inside of the place and started to close up (we ended up chatting with them about local bars); the second time, we hung out outside while they closed, cleaned, and reopened again for a band later that night.  It's a relaxed, friendly atmosphere, and the people who work here feel like genuinely good people.  No pretentiousness at all.  As for the coffee, I know it's probably super unhealthy, but I love the Dark Chocolate Mocha Smash.  With whipped cream.  Lots of whipped cream.  Try it, but don't sue me when you get diabetes later in life.  It's worth it.
I got a breakfast burrito and I thought I wouldn't finish it because it was pretty big, but it was really good besides the fact that it was vegan.
Great atmosphere excellent coffee great staff great deserts looking forward to come back again !

Wow! That's all I have to say. From the service, to the food, to the chai tea latte I got, it was all awesome! Nick and Jeff were inviting and fun to get to know - and they make awesome food. Thanks for the great experience, guys! We'll be back.

The barista here (bearded guy, didn't get his name unfortunately) is the best. I imagine he must have gone to the top of a coffee mountain and learned the secrets of a trade from an old monk, because the latte he made me was the best I've ever had.   I also highly suggest going for the #3 breakfast burrito if that's your persuasion!
The staff is always friendly, and they go out of their way to make you feel welcome.

This place is walking distance from me. It's the only 24 hour cafe I know of in this city. The coffee is decent. I haven't tried the food. They also have beer and wine which is fantastic. The inside is decorated well. The patio outside is really nice but only during times when it's not busy on noisy 7th st - especially the obnoxious loud motorcycles (which should have been made illegal a long time ago). Anyway, very cozy space to work, chill or chat. The people working here are very nice too. Why am I giving it 4 stars rather than 5? Their internet is a bit spotty. It's frustrating trying to work when I have to reset my connectivity every 5-10 minutes. If they fix this (which shouldn't be difficult), they earn 5 stars.

It is a pretty good little local coffee shop.  They have some nice vegan and gluten free pastries and food.  Wish there were more items to choose from in the case. The staff is always really nice and seem to take pride is what they do.  Does have some whack hours - not open late which is too bad.  Also the Starbucks close by is a bummer

The coffee was great, the atmosphere relaxed, the staff all very helpful and friendly.  The pear and almond scone was truly amazing.  Crisp where it should be and soft inside. A true delight. I like the fact that it was light and sunny  inside; too much here feels dark. I know, the sun etc but it can be gloomy.
I've enjoyed coffee and iced tea here before. Excellent service and chill atmosphere. I like their patio facing 7th street. Very cozy and comfortable. Hope to be back again soon!

Is it me or is this place downright filthy? Don't get me wrong the burritos are amazing and the coffee is average, but the place is dirty. If you ever get the chance just look around. I noticed dirty dishes, floors, air vents, and dirty appliances. I leaned against the countertop at the bar and my elbows were greeted by a sticky substance. In the pastry windows, there were crumbs and leftover pastries just sitting there. Will not be going again.

After a very early 6 am flight into Phoenix, I was exhausted and starving.  I couldn't check into my hotel until 3, so I had lots of time to waste.  Being a new-ish vegan, I opened up the Happy Cow app on my phone and saw Urban Beans. Perfect! First off, I work for Starbucks, and I passed by at least 2 Starbucks to come to Urban Beans.  And I'm not disappointed.  I chose the GF banana oat walnut muffin and an iced hibiscus tea.  The muffin is delicious, the tea is exactly what I needed, and I am grateful for the free WiFi. Man, I wish we had a cafe like this back home.  I'd apply to work here and I'd come here every day.

I've been going here for awhile now but felt compelled to review it right now because I am, as I am typing this, enjoying a fresh rasberry-peach scone that is still warm.  (Go in when they first open to get them fresh out of the oven) This place has the most exciting assortment of baked goods compared to other coffee shops that only offer sad, overcooked cookies, stale scones, etc.,  Their scones are baked in the store and they have awesome flavors using different combinations of fresh fruit.  The iced coffee is really nice too. It is really smooth and not too bitter.
